The classical music festival that has been held annually since 1939, the San Sebastián Musical Fortnight, will offer shows and concerts. Although during its first years of life it lasted only two weeks, the Festival has been consolidating over time and thanks to the support of the public the Musical Fortnight progressively extended its duration that from a few years hitherto covers the whole of August.

 

Opera, ballet, the great symphonic orchestras, the small chamber groups, the romantic organ, the choral groups, contemporary composers, local promises, the great names of the international scene, the shows for children… all of them have a place in the San Sebastián Musical Fortnight that beyond its main headquarters at the Kursaal Palace and the Victoria Eugenia Theatre resounds in many and singular spaces, not only in San Sebastián but also in Gipuzkoan territory.

The popular Magdalena festivity is an emblematic celebration with great repercussion in most of the Busturialdea region, above all in Bermeo, Mundaka and Elantxobe. Thousands of people dressed in typical nankeen shirts approach these municipalities aiming to enjoy their amazing festive atmosphere. Bermeo and Mundaka commemorate and perform the quarrel between both towns to obtain the custody of the Isle of Izaro.

On July 22nd the Bermeo's Council gets together to attend the High Mass in Santa Eufemia church. Soon after, the bands liven up the streets with their music and the representatives of the local authorities leave the town by boat towards Elantxobe, stopping at the rear of the island to throw a tile as a symbol of Bermeo's property of the island. In the evening, the boat continues from Elantxobe towards Mundaka and arrives finally in Bermeo, after one hour and thirty minutes. Passacaglias and bands welcome the crew, which heads towards the town hall. A mass concert marks the end of the celebrations.

Arrigorriaga, Plentzia and Trapagaran -Arboleda neighbourhood- also arrange events on the occasion. But these fiestas are not only held in Bizkaia. Errenteria, for example, arranges endless activities throughout a week aiming at different audiences: religious celebrations, sports competitions, concerts, traditional activities, and games for the little ones, open-air dances, street entertainment, and so on. As to Alava, towns such as Artziniega, Ayala or Bernedo (Urturi), among others, also celebrate Magdalena festivities.

The International Folklore Festival of Portugalete and the Basque Country hosts every year music and dance groups from all over the world. Many of these groups, which over centuries have known how to preserve and keep their traditions and cultures, will meet at the International Folklore Festival of Portugalete and the Basque Country.

Over nine days, festivities will take over the city streets and thousands of people will meet on the streets to enjoy the good atmosphere and the numerous cultural activities available on the festivities' programme.

It was in 1978 that several associations from Bilbao decided to organise a contest of ideas to create a Big Week in Bilbao, as up to that date only a few scattered activities of little importance for the citizens used to take place in Bilbao. So, "Aste Nagusia de Bilbao" (Bilbao's Big Week) originated.

After more than 40 years it has turned into one of the most popular and most visited festivities in Euskadi. This year the fiestas will kick off on Aug. 22nd to finish on Aug. 30th. Following the mythical "txupinazo" (burst of fireworks that announces the start of the festivities) and the opening speech, the peculiar Marijaia, symbol of the festivities, will look out of the balcony of the Arriaga Theatre to give way to the celebrations.

The musical offer is one of the attractions of the Aste Nagusia, this year there will be more than 100 free performances in 8 venues. 

On the last day of the festivities, Marijaia will once more be the leading figure. The peculiar character will be burnt in the square of the Arriaga theatre, in from of hundreds of spectators, thus marking the end of the "Aste Nagusia de Bilbao" (Bilbao's Big Week).

datosGenerales.nombre: The Clásica San Sebastian Cycle Race
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Once again, a new edition of the Clásica San Sebastián will cover the province of Gipuzkoa. Clásica San Sebastián forms part of the UCI ProTour and the route is 225 kilometres in length.

Some of the most renowned cyclists on the current cycling scene come together for another year to race in the Clásica San Sebastián. Indeed, many of the names that have been highlighted the most in this Tour de France will be in this race pertaining to the UCI Pro Tour, considered one of the most important events in international cycling.

From noon the best worldwide riders will be in the starting line.From the capital of Gipuzkoa the riders will cover almost the whole province, climbing mountain passes such as Udana, Azkarate and Meagas.

 

Alto de Jaizkibel climb, of category 1, is the toughest. It is 30 kilometres from the finish, which turns out to be crucial for the winner. The finish will be at the Boulevard of San Sebastián at about 5:30 pm.

On August 4th thousands will gather at the plaza de la Virgen Blanca Square in order to enjoy the beginning of the most important fiestas of Vitoria-Gasteiz.

The descent of Celedon, popular and emblematic figure of the city, takes place at 6pm. It is also worth mentioning that although the fiestas do not begin officially until August 4th, there are several activities -within the so-called "prefiestas" - from July 26 onwards.

Without a shadow of a doubt, the wide range of music is one of the biggest attractions of the festivals in Vitoria-Gasteiz. 

The extensive programme includes food fairs and craft fairs, plenty of activities for the little kiddies, spectacular fireworks, tastings, concerts by well-known bertsolaris, an Arab souk which will be installed in the Plaza de Juan de Ayala and the most interesting of activities such as sack races and tricycles, the Miss and Mister contest or the boat launching competition, to name but a few, will also be held.

The Araia-Asparrena Comedy Theatre Festival returns with an extensive programme that is set to delight both young and old alike. Between August 11 and 15, humour, acrobatics, dance, music and magic go hand in hand in this town on the Plains of Álava. 

 

In addition, during August other Alava towns will play host to a multitude of outdoor performances: Amurrio, Berantevilla, Etxabarri Ibiña, Izarra, Labastida, Llodio, Loza, Maeztu, Manzanos, Okondo, Oteo, Pobes, Ribabellosa, Salinas de Añana, San Román de Campezo, Villanañe, Vírgala Mayor, Zubillaga and Zuhatzu-Kuartango.

The Semana Grande (Big Week) festivities of San Sebastián begins each year with the traditional Cañonazo (Cannon shot), which is launched from Alderdi Eder, and the interpretation of the Artillero (artilleryman) song.

One of the most important elements of the Semana Grande is, without a doubt, the International Fireworks Contest, which includes the participation of companies from different parts of the world. Also, music has an important place in the festival. Great musical stars gather in the capital of Gipuzkoa.

As far as sports is concerned, it is worth mentioning the classic swimming crossing from Getaria to San Sebastian, horse races, the beach-volleyball tournament and "herri-kirolak" exhibitions (Basque rural sports). Furthermore, and like in previous years, children will have at their disposal workshops, games, gigantes and cabezudos parades, disco, toros de fuego (fire bulls), and so on.

The concerts are one of the highlights of the Semana Grande de San Sebastián, this year the following will perform in Sagüés: Amparanoia, Esne Beltza, Nil Moliner, NØGEN...

galeria.titulo: A cannon shot marks the beginning of the fiestas

datosGenerales.descripcion:
One of the most important days of the festivals in Ondarroa is the Arrantzale Eguna or Fisherman's Day.

 

Just like every year, on August 17th, the coastal town will be decked out in navy blue to celebrate the big day on their calendar. Following tradition, nankeen clothing and espadrilles will fill the streets with colour and the bars in the port will welcome the groups of friends on this festive day. The festivities will start in the morning, and there will be a multitude of activities for kids, such as traditional folkloric music played in the streets by groups of locals, dances, a procession and a firework display that will delight the whole family. The emblematic characters known as Kortzeleko Mamuak will bid farewell at midnight.

 

Following the tradition that a group of young people from the village started in 1957, for another year Ondarroa opens its doors to anyone who wants to enjoy a pleasant day in this coastal town of Bizkaia.

datosGenerales.nombre: Festivities of San Roque and Nuestra Señora de la Asunción
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Many towns in the Basque Country celebrate festivities in mid August honouring Nuestra Señora de la Asunción (Aug. 15th) and San Roque (Aug. 16th).

 

In Alava, for instance, the town of Llodio holds the feasts on August 15th-25th where everyone who attends will have the chance to participate in contests, enjoy sports activities -hockey, Basque pelota, skate boarding, basket, rural sports, bowling-, activities for the children, theatre plays, magic tricks, gastronomic tastings, open-air dances, running of the bulls and concerts, among others. The festive atmosphere also floods the streets of Amurrio with the presence of endless, such as Desfile de Carrozas (float parade), in which groups of young people take part. Fiestas' programme combines sports, gastronomy and leisure. Moreda de Alava, Nanclares de Oca, Elvillar and Asparrena are just a few of Alava's areas that celebrate these festivities during these days.

 

As for the province of Bizkaia, the towns get decked out to hold San Roque festivities. To begin, Portugalete (Aug. 14th-17th) will be home to several activities such as a medieval market, the traditional Jotas contest, and concerts. What's more, Gernika-Lumo (Aug. 14th-18th) will play host to several contests, sports events -rural sports, cesta punta...-, Basque dance shows, bertsolaris (singers of extemporary composed songs in Basque) and gigs. Other towns celebrating Nuestra Señora de la Asunción or San Roque festivities are Ondarroa -with its emblematic Arrantzale Eguna-, Larrabetzu, Gorliz, Mallabia and Meñaka, among others.

 

Moreover, San Roque festivities are very important in many towns of the province of Gipuzkoa, such as Deba (Aug. 14th-18th). There, religious celebrations, sports competitions, rural activities, open-air dances and street music bands ("txarangas") will be taking place apart from bullfights and Basque dances such as Ezpata Dantza, Esku-Dantza and Jorrai Dantza. As for Gabiria the town has a marked rural taste thanks to a combination of rural sports exhibition, folk dances, bertsolaris, open-air dances and games for the children. And Zarautz, Aduna, Elgoibar and Zumarraga also celebrate the fiestas.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Laudio/Llodio; Amurrio; Moreda de Álava/Moreda Araba; Iruña Oka/Iruña de Oca; Elvillar/Bilar; Asparrena; Ondarroa; Portugalete; Gernika-Lumo; Larrabetzu; Gorliz; Mallabia; Meñaka; Deba; Gabiria; Zarautz; Aduna; Elgoibar; Zumarraga

datosGenerales.descripcion:
On September the 8th, the Virgin of Guadalupe Day, the "Alarde" is held in the coastal municipality of Hondarribia.

The alarde is a procession that is held every year to celebrate the vows made to the Virgin of Guadalupe in 1639 in gratitude for breaking the siege imposed to the town by French troops. Thousands of participants group in many companies and participate in the parade that takes place through the streets of the borough.

The companies are made up of fifes; drum rolls, drums, rifles and a "cantinera" (serving girl). After touring the streets of Hondarribia, the participants climb up to the Sanctuary of Guadalupe, where an open-air dance occurs. In the afternoon, the procession takes place once again but this time, to descend to the town where the festival continues.

Goose Day, which is to be celebrated on Sept. 5th, is the most important day within San Antolín festivities. Known as "Antzar Eguna" or "Día de los Gansos", the origin of the tradition dates back over 300 years.

 

The harbour is the setting for the celebration. As every year, thousands of Lekeitio inhabitants will dress in the typical blue shirt of nankeen and the gingham neckerchief in order to welcome the festivity.

 

Groups of youths are the protagonists throughout the day. Many of them will get onboard ships and one will grab the neck of a goose -dead or made of rubber- that has previously been hung from a rope upside down and then, jump into the water. A group of people will be responsible for pulling the ropes and let them go so that the participant will jump into the air and subsequently into the water.

 

The game consists in beheading a dead goose. This is one of the most celebrated events in the Basque Country and the day will conclude with many music shows and street performances.

Within the unparalleled setting known as La Concha Bay, thousands of people gather on the first two Sundays in September to enjoy the traditional San Sebastián regattas.

The over-130-year old event was held for the first time in 1879 as a new activity included in the San Sebastián fiestas programme. This is an essential appointment for those who love this sport and for all the people in general, as these days good atmosphere and festivities will prevail in every corner of the city.

The Rioja Alavesa Wine Harvest Festival is a road show festival started in 1994 in the town of Laguardia. This massive event aims to inform visitors about the municipalities, their lifestyle and principally about wine as the main product of rural development in the region. Each year, after the crushing of the grapes and the tasting of the first must, the tasting of the wines from the Rioja Alavesa begins.

 

This year, Navaridas will be filled with stands dedicated to the different localities that make up the Rioja Alavesa region.

 

Additionally, the extensive programme of events includes an aizkolaris (wood chopping) tournament, a local lunch, performances by musical and dance groups, games and activities of various kinds for children, parades with traditional folkloric music played in the streets by groups of locals and a small fair bringing together artisan products bearing the quality mark.

Gernika-Lumo plays host to a special fair on September 2nd. The event focuses on Biscay's cider and goat cheese, where producing companies of Busturialdea region and guests of the sector will be taking part.

 

As the name points out, the main attractions at the fair are cider and rabbit from Biscay. Those who approach the town will also be able to buy more products such as sweets, bread, cheese, fruit, vegetables, and so on. In addition, the fair will be holding stalls displaying Basque handicrafts.

 

This fair is one of the five monographic markets that the Gernika-Lumo Town Council is in charge of arranging between June and December, on the first Saturday of each month.

Getxophoto photography festival opts for exploring and experimenting with exhibition formats and venues, largely public spaces, though without neglecting the usual venues.

This is one of its main distinctive features. It sets out not to decorate Getxo but to use it to tell stories through specially-chosen images.

Making use of everything from building frontages to shop windows and including containers, bars, patios and other constructions, Getxophoto aims to bring different points of view to the public, and not just place photographs as works to be looked at, but awaken feelings around them: involvement, questioning, linkage between people and pictures, between residents and visitors.

Without neglecting local photographers, Getxophoto is determined to be an international festival while at the same time seeking active involvement by the community where it takes place.

As well as the exhibition, the festival has a strong educational component and hosts workshops, guided tours, presentations, film shows and talks.

Shepherd's Day (Artzain Eguna or Día del Pastor) honours local shepherds by arranging several activities. Inter-provincial Championship of Latxa dairy sheep is scheduled to take place over the morning, where shepherds from different areas of Alava and Orduña and Orozko (Biscay) will participate.

At this time, sheep with the best milk seconding will be displayed and the Contest of Cheese from Gipuzkoa with Idiazabal Denomination of Origin will be set forth. Apart from photographs and traditional utensils, objects and dogs will be on display as follows: handicrafts, agricultural machinery and sheepdogs.

Evidently, several exhibitions will be included in the planning, such as cheese making, traditional sheep shearing and Neo Zealander style, cheese tasting, latxa breed meat and products stemming from latxa breed.

Throughout the day, shepherds from Alava will receive the recognition they deserve for their duty. The programme includes different events, to conclude with the Sheepdog Contest.

Muskiz will play host to the celebrated farming and cattle fair on September 17th. 

 

One of the most remarkable moments will be when different products from kitchen gardens and farms will be at the clients' disposal so that they can taste and buy them. We should mention products such as txakoli wine, bread, cake, sausages, cold meat, honey, sheep cheese, fruit and vegetables. Moreover, the animals will be in charge of attracting the attendees' attention by means of a horse contest with the subsequent prizes in cash and trophies where the best breeds of the region will be selected.

 

Do not miss the sheep exhibition.

galeria.titulo: Poster of the Fair in Muskiz

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The International Theatre Festival is one of the most relevant cultural events from Vitoria-Gasteiz. There all genres are hold, from classical to avant-garde.

 

In the wide range of this 48th edition, you will be able to enjoy a score of shows, among which the presence of works such as the Vicky Luengo, Ana Belén, Pepe Viyuela, Nuria Espert,  Pepón Nieto...

The local Baserritarras (Basque farmers) come together in order to show a wide range of their best products.

The traditional farmhouse goods contest cheese, bread, txakoli wine, honey, vegetables and plants is remarkable, with over 60 years of history. Although this contest is the main event, this fair is also known because of its local cattle display, which exhibits some of the best examples of the region. Bargain Day programme is full of activities.

Roast beef is one of the most characteristic activities and later they make "pintxos" with it.

Cross Tres Playas is due to take place on Sunday, October 8th. As its name points out, the race runs through three beaches from San Sebastián: La Concha, Ondarreta and Zurriola.

 

The start and the finishing line are the same point and will be located in the neighbourhood of El Antiguo. This is a 10-kilometre quick marathon that starts at 10am and the contestants have one hour and a half to finish it.

 

Over the years the race has been consolidating as one of the most important sport events of San Sebastián by exceeding 3,000 participants.

The International Theatre Festival of Santurtzi this year celebrates 44 editions.

 

The Festival will begin on 26th October and will end on 26th November, taking place 21 magnificent shows, which will be performed at the Serantes Kultur Aretoa theater.

The local fiestas in San Fausto are very much celebrated in towns like Basauri and Durango. Basauri, for example, is hosting a jam-packed programme of activities from 7th to 15th October.

 

Once again, the emblematic zurrakapote will take centre stage during the local fiestas. This is a drink made with red wine, lemon, sugar and cinnamon. All the localBasauri groups of friends give away zurrakapote (in exchange for willingness) to those who come by with their wine pitcher to the bar at the market area, that is turned into makeshift stands,txosnas, during the local fiestas.

 

In Durango, the local fiestas will also take place from 12st to 22th October, even though various activities will be organized the days before and after the official dates. The performances by the bertsolaris (bertso singers), trikitilaris (accordion players), dantzaris (dancers), dulzaineros (dulzaina/double reed aerophone players) and txistularis (txistu/fipple flute players) liven up the streets of both towns, which also include, within the festival programme, activities for the txikisor little kiddies, contests of various kinds, tastings, local lunches, mushroom exhibitions, religious processions or a wide range of sporting activities (herri-kirolak- a local Basque sport, basketball, archery...).

With every passing year, the Tolosa Choral Contest has gradually established itself as one of the most important choral contests in the world. Its main goal is to attract the best choral groups in the world while at the same time showcasing Basque traditional music and culture.

 

The event is divided up into three categories: the Chamber Choirs category (consisting of the Basque songs and folklore and polyphony modalities), the Children's Choirs category, and the Vocal Groups category (consisting of the sacred music and secular music modalities).

 

Participants: Gaos (Galicia), Auruim (Asturias), Collegium Musicum Berlin Chamber Choir (Germany), Männerstimmen Basel (Switzerland), JCA National Youth Choir (Japan), Batavia Madrigal Singers (Indonesia), Consolatio Choir (Indonesia), Gema Sangkakala (Indonesia), Swara Vocal Ensemble (Belgium), Glier Institute (Ukrania), Festino Vocal Ensemble (Russia), Art'n Voices Vocal Ensemble (Poland) and Vocal Group Era (Letonia), among others.

datosGenerales.nombre: San Sebastian Horror and Fantasy Film Festival
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Lovers of intense excitement, fear and gore are eagerly looking forward to theHorror and Fantasy Film Festival of San Sebastián.

 

This competition brings together the best short films and feature films of the year in this genre, in the official sections of the festival.

 

Also, the San Sebastian Horror and Fantasy Film Festival usually runs in conjunction with a wide range of parallel activities being organized: exhibitions, film seasons, children's activities and events devoted to the world of comics.

datosContacto.direccion: Teatro Principal-Antzoki Zaharra, Teatro Victoria Eugenia Antzokia, Kursaal

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Behobia-San Sebastian is not a typical race as we know it. This is an event that has great impact and attracts thousands of participants from around the world every year. It is considered one of the most important fun runs in Euskadi.

 

The event covers a 20 kilometre route. The runners set off from the Behobia neighbourhood in Irun and they end the course in Boulevard Donostiarra. The most difficult sections are the steep uphill sections at the peaks of Gaintxurizketa and Miracruz.

 

The applause and the cheers from the crowds gathered on the streets abound throughout the whole race.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Irun; Lezo; Pasaia; Donostia / San Sebastián

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Within San Severino patron saint festivities, Balmaseda will be home to the traditional International Putxeras Contest on October 23rd.

Putxera is an emblematic dish consisting of beans, pork fat, chorizo and black pudding. The origin of this speciality comes from engine drivers of the railway that connected Bilbao and Leon. In winter, when the cold prevented them from getting out of the train to have lunch, engine drivers heated up their meal in a stew pot or putxera with the steam from the train motor.

The event was first time held in 1971 and since then it has turned into one of the most important traditions in the town of Bizkaia. Large groups of friends known as "cuadrillas" gather together in Plaza San Severino Square to cook putxera their way and under the supervision of many onlookers. Several prizes are given in cash.

Moreover, many other activities are organised for that day, including a popular meal, a procession, street music bands, an open-air dance, and so on.

One more year the magic of puppetry will permeate all corners of the Biscayan capital.

 

This year the festival will take place between 19th and 27th November and will include the participation of Basque and international companies.

 

In short, this is a special tribute to the world of puppets that will delight both young and old alike.

Durangoko Azoka is the place of meeting of the different agents of the Basque culture: writters, musicians, culture’s lovers, “euskaltzales”, mass media… a big shop window in which writers and musicians have the opportunity to approach its readership and listeners, in addition to presenting and announcing new projects.

 

The Landako exhibition site of Durango, it receives hundreds of stands, in which they give themselves appointment the publishing, record houses, cultural associations or institutions of diverse nature. 

 

Every day, as son as the doors of Landako will be closed, the ambience continues with the performances of different musical groups.

galeria.titulo: Durangoko Azoka, Basque Book and CD/record Fair

datosGenerales.nombre: San Martín Fair in Santa Cruz de Campezo
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Santa Cruz de Campezo will hold an agricultural, livestock and artisan show on November 12th due to the festivities of San Martín.

 

Activities included in the comprehensive programme are scheduled to start at 10am. Gastronomy will play an important role throughout the day, apart from having the possibility to buy the typical products from Montaña Alavesa the attendees will be allowed to participate in a succulent tasting.

 

There will be also a gastronomic contest and an artisan exhibition and livestock show.

For a couple of days Tolosa will be paying tribute to one of its most characteristic pieces of produce: the bean. Without a doubt, the Gipuzkoan locality will, once again, become a meeting point for lovers of this legume.

 

Thus, on 15th November the Tolosa Bean Producer Contest will be held in the Plaza del Triángulo. Visitors will be able to purchase a multitude of produce connected in some manner to the bean (chilli peppers, black pudding or wine, to name but a few).

 

Furthermore, the Tolosa Bean Cuisine Competition, will take place in the Tinglado Market on 16th, with a prize being awarded to the chefs who best cook the winning bean from the producers competition, and which will be followed by a bean-based dinner for all those gathered.

Bilbao Herri Krosa (City Marathon) is a non-competitive popular race that has gained followers of different ages edition after edition. Racers will meet on mid-November to participate in the event that will also attract numerous onlookers who will cheer up athletes with praises and applause.

 

The 10 kilometre-long route begins and ends in the same place: Bilbao's Gran Vía. Racers will be running along some of Bilbao's main streets, such as Arenal, Hurtado de Amezaga, Sabino Arana, Sagrado Corazón, Máximo Aguirre and Alameda Mazarredo, among others.

The Lekeitio Film and Video Festival will take place between the 20th and 28th of November this year. The festival has taken place for over three decades now and it's main objective remains the same; to raise public awareness of audiovisual production in Basque language. Whether produced by professionals, amateurs or beginners, all the films share one common feature: they have all been filmed in Basque. It is currently the only contest of it's kind that takes place in the Basque Country.

 

The works chosen for the competition will be shown in the Ikusgarri Cinema in Lekeitio.

The Bernaola Festival is one of the most emblematic musical events in Vitoria-Gasteiz.

On this occasion more than a dozen concerts have been organized featuring Ensemble Kuraia, Anthony Pateras & Drumming Gp and Ensemble Sinkro, among others.

The Jesús Guridi conservatory of music will be the main venue for the festival and will also include venues as diverse as the Artium as well as the Andra Mari Aretoa in Araia.

Apart from being one of the most famous "bilbainadas" -typical music style from Bizkaia-, Desde Santurce a Bilbao (From Santurce to Bilbao) is the name of a popular race held for over 20 years. The route, measuring 16 km, goes through Santurtzi, Portugalete, Sestao, Barakaldo and Bilbao. Thousands of people from all over the world participate every year in the contest.

 

A race that gives the chance of gazing at some of the most characteristic spots of the left bank of the River Nervión and Bilbao.

datosContacto.direccion:
Salida: Polideportivo de Santurtzi
Llegada: Gran Vía de Bilbao

datosGenerales.nombre: San Andrés Fair in Eibar and Azkoitia
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The San Andrés Fair which is held every year in November both in Eibar as well as in Azkoitia, is the first important date in the calendar of autumn and winter fairs.

Thus, in Eibar producers from the region put their best products on display for visitors in Plaza Untzaga: vegetables, fruit, honey, cheese and bread, to name but a few. A panel of judges is responsible for making a selection of the most outstanding pieces of produce. An exhibition of poultry and livestock from the Bajo Deba region will also be held. Parades with traditional folkloric music played in the streets by groups of locals, bertsolaris (verse singers), trikitilaris (accordion players) y txistularis (txistu/fipple flute players) liven up the fair. In addition, as part of the fair various types of events are held, amongst which the Pintxos Competition stands out.

Furthermore, Azkoitia held the San Andrés fair for the first time in 1752. In its early days the event went on for more than a week. Presently, the fair, which is not competitive, is set up and takes place in the main square, and plays host to the display and sale of agricultural and artisan produce and it is the main hub of activity on St. Andrew's Day. Other activities during the day's events include a herri-kirolak (local Basque sport) festival and the idi probak, Basque stone dragging oxherd tests.

Rural atmosphere reigns in Santo Tomás festivity, which is the day that marks the start of Christmas time. Many towns in the Basque Country celebrate this special day but it is in San Sebastián, Bilbao, Azpeitia, Lekeitio, Errenteria, Irun, Hondarribia, Usurbil and Arrasate/Mondragón where most people celebrate the festivity. Most towns celebrate it on December 21st. In Arrasate/Mondragón, where it also takes place on the 22nd -an is known as "Santamasak".

No doubt Santo Tomás attracts thousands of people every year. All of them are willing to taste all sorts of remarkable products, such as chorizo (food encompassing several types of pork sausage), talo (typical Basque food similar to the traditional tortilla of Central America, made of corn flour and water), and cider. Cheese, txakoli (Basque white wine), rosquillas (type of doughnuts), honey, sweets, fruit, vegetables and handicrafts will also be at the clients' disposal.

Furthermore, the fair will be packed with many exhibitions on farm animals where those who attend will have the chance to observe pigs and hens. Music is also protagonist on Santo Tomás day. Bertsolaris (singers of bertsos, a type of Basque musical verse), trikitilaris (players of trikitixa, two-row Basque diatonic button accordion), txalapartaris (players of txalaparta, Basque music device of wood or stone) and several bands will liven up the atmosphere.

Moreover, the little ones will have fun with a wide range of games and activities that have been especially arranged for them.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Donostia / San Sebastián; Bilbao; Arrasate/Mondragón; Azpeitia

galeria.titulo: Rural atmosphere reigns in Santo Tomás Fair
Music is also protagonist on Santo Tomás day

datosGenerales.descripcion:
December 3rd will be a very special day for Errezil inhabitants. Every year, the town holds the Apple Fair on the first Sunday in December.

The fair aims to boost and spread the local apples for many, the best in Gipuzkoa. Errezilgo Azoka and Atala Kultur Elkartea are responsible for arranging such event. Besides, those who attend will find derivates of apple, such as natural cider, jam, compote and delicious desserts.

But if your are not satisfied, you will have the chance to enjoy a practice show of how cider was made in past times. Step by step they will explain the complex process of cider making and several stands displaying handicrafts will also be installed.

Mountaineering enthusiasts are in luck! A new edition of the BBK Mendi Film Bilbao-Bizkaia Festival will take place from 8th to 17th December and Bilbao is the setting. Activities related to mountaineering, adventure and extreme sports are featured in the more than forty productions which will be screened as part of the competition.

As in previous years, the leading actors and directors of the screened films will visit the city to share their incredible experiences with the audience.

The programme also includes talks, exhibitions and lectures as well as various activities in the streets of the capital of the Biscay province.

galeria.titulo: EL GRAN HITO, Ignasi López Fábregas, 2020

datosGenerales.nombre: The Christmas Amusement Park for Children (PIN)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Christmas Amusement Park for Children, PIN, is synonym for satisfaction and entertainment. The offer will be present in many areas of our geography to delight the little ones. The all-embracing planning provides activities addressing the children of all ages. The little ones will have the chance to enjoy with crayons, bouncy castles, trampolines, board games and entertainment attractions. Apart from common workshops, adults will love practising Tyrolean crossing, climbing, kart racing, role-playing games, videogames, and so on. There will also be room for music performances and dances.

 

Bilbao Exhibition Centre December 16h- January 7th

It is the Bilbao Exhibition Centre that has arranged a large amount of activities for the children. Rides, games, Internet rooms, educational, culture and sports programmes, tournaments, contests, toy libraries and exhibitions.

 

Kursaal December 22nd - January 4th

Games, special draws, karaoke shows, a tombola, videogames, a track for bicycles and motorbikes, workshops, scalextric, bouncy castles, are just a few of the activities organised by Lankor association to be held at the Kursaal Christmas Amusement Park for Children.

 

Europa Palace (Vitoria-Gasteiz) December 26th - January 16th

Alongside the traditional fun areas - slides, trampolines, electric cars and more - and activities, the Vitoria-Gasteiz Christmas children's park offers workshops to develop values such as equality and diversity.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Irun; Donostia / San Sebastián; Barakaldo; Vitoria-Gasteiz; Durango; Tolosa; Amurrio; Eibar

datosGenerales.nombre: Cavalcade of the Three Wise Men
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Caspar, Melchior and Balthasar are the Kings from the East who will arrive in the Basque Country in order to hand over gifts to the children. On the evening of January 5th Christmas fleets, massively spread all over the Basque geography will parade along the streets. As for the night, the Three Wise Men will bear presents for the children who are awaiting them while sleeping. According to this tradition, the children who have behaved badly during the last year receive coal -ade of sugar- instead of gifts. Magic, fantasy and illusion are the main ingredients of the day.

Vitoria-Gasteiz: The Three Wise Men will arrive at the RENFE station in the Alavese capital in the morning and and shortly afterwards they will walk along Dato Street to Plaza Nueva where they will be greeted from the balcony of the Town Hall. The parade will depart from Plaza Bilbao at 19:00.

Bilbao: The streets of Botxo once again welcome a show filled with light and colour. Melchior, Gaspar and Balthasar will be the absolute protagonists in a parade which about three hundred people will take part in. The parade will start at 18:00 and will go along the Gran Vía and end at the City Hall. They will meet the little ones, in the Arab Hall in Bilbao City Hall.

Donostia / San Sebastián: Their Majesties will reach the city once again. Their route is set to begin in Boulevard in order to cover the city centre and give out sweets. As every year, torchbearers, animals and music accompany them.

galeria.titulo: Cavalcade of the Three Wise Men

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Lapuebla de Labarca holds on Feb. 10th a new edition of the Uztaberri Eguna, a meeting point for those who love wine and good gastronomy. Twenty local wineries open their gates to all visitors, providing them with the chance of tasting the wine produced using grapes from the latest harvest.

 

Furthermore, Uztaberri Eguna has plenty of activities tightly connected to the rural world and the wine production in Rioja Alavesa. The celebration kicks off in the morning followed by the opening of several "txokos" that provide attendees with some of their best products, such as type of doughnuts, oil and olives, soap or "arrope-sweet" (a dessert elaborated by using grape juice).

Many towns of the Basque Country celebrate carnivals in a special way but the most popular and overcrowded are held in Tolosa.

The big party starts officially on "Big Thursday". At noon the opening speech is given followed by the burst of fireworks. Within the next day ("Weak Friday") programme the Festival is the most remarkable activity: Leidor Theatre stages a performance when the protagonists are the town inhabitants. On Saturday, "Zaldunita bezpera", Tamborradas (parades led by adults and the children) take place across the streets of Tolosa.

On Sunday, the streets will be packed with inhabitants dressed in pyjamas and slippers as if they had recently woken up. That day, as well as on Monday ("Astelehenita") and on Tuesday ("Asteartita") floats and bands parade across the streets accompanied by music and dances.

The celebration concludes on Tuesday with "the burial of the sardine", although "Piñata Igandea" comes along with the rhythms of street bands.

The Basque Autonomous Region celebrates carnivals in a special way. For several days, entertainment and good atmosphere fill the streets and towns of our geography.

The most popular and overcrowded Gipuzkoa carnivals are held in Tolosa. The big party starts officially on Big Thursday and concludes on Tuesday with "the burial of the sardine".

As for carnivals in San Sebastián, "comparsas" -groups participating in carnivals-, dressed as Caldereros, Percebes, Jardineros, Gallos, are of great importance as they honour Dios Momo, the main character.

To finish, youngsters from Amezketa and Abaltzisketa go all over nearby farmhouses asking for pocket money. There are known as "txantxoak".

 

In Biscay, Bilbao celebrates the popular carnivals with a traditional trial. "Farolín" and "Zarambolas" are taken to the traditional trial on the first carnival day. Both figures represent the showing off and kindness that is a characteristic of Bilbao citizens. Besides, "comparsas" become more prominent among the overcrowded beginning of carnivals also known as "bajada".

Not only Bilbao, but also the coastal town of Mundaka celebrates in a special way. "Atorras" (male inhabitants) and "lamias" (female inhabitants) are the undisputed characters in town.

What is more, the traditional carnivals of Markina-Xemein are also worth mentioning. Young "dantzaris" (Basque dancers) perform "zaragi-dantza" or "danza del odre" down the streets on Sunday. A fearsome bear accompanies the "comparsa" with a tamer that is responsible for keeping ghosts away and frighten children off.

 

Several areas in Álava give a warm welcome to carnivals. In fact, Vitoria carnivals kick off with "Jueves de Lardero". But , the climax is reached on the weekend thanks to the celebrated fancy dress contest and the overcrowded parade of "comparsas". The event comes to an end with the burial of the sardine in the Plaza Nueva Square.

In addition, Zalduondo celebrates a rural-character carnival. The popular event is considered to be one of the oldest celebrations of Álava. Together with many carnival characters, Zalduondo inhabitants parade up and down on Sunday with an eccentric puppet known as "Markitos". Its life is short as after standing trial the puppet is burnt at the stake before the inhabitants of Zalduondo. The emblematic character represents the evilness of natives. So, when Markitos is burnt all the inhabitants' sins are expiated. And do not forget carnivals in Ilarduia, Egino and Andoin, Laudio, Santa Cruz de Campezo, Agurain -where people disguise themselves as "porreros" and "sorginas"- or Salcedo (Lantarón), where a puppet known as "Porretero" ends up onto a roof.

Food lovers cannot miss the event that will take place in Ribabellosa on February 11th.The town is to hold a new edition of the International Black Truffle Fair.

There will be creating stupendous dishes using black truffle, one of the most celebrated ingredients in Haute Cuisine. Other activities on the day will include a talks, show cooking sessions and a truffle-hunting dog exhibition.

galeria.titulo: Alava's black truffle, main character at the fair

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Holy Week is the Christian holidays from Palm Sunday to Resurrection Sunday, although these days also include the previous Friday (Holy Friday).

 

Biscay

 

These days, Biscay focuses on Balmaseda and Bilbao, since the celebrations are very spectacular in both cities. Every year masses of visitors meet up in Balmaseda's Way of Sorrows. For months, Balmaseda inhabitants have been rehearsing to show realism during the acts that are accompanied by processions and chants. Over 500 inhabitants perform different scenes from the life of Jesus on Maundy Thursday and Holy Friday. On Maundy Thursday, those who attend will enjoy "The Last Supper", "Prayer in Gethsemane" and "the Seizure of Jesus". As for Holy Friday, at 9am Roman guards play the drums announcing they are ready for the trial of Jesus before Pilato, the Hanging of Judas and a procession down the streets up to the spot where the scene of the Crucifixion will take place.

 

In Bizkaia's capital, Bilbao, over 3,000 members of religious brotherhoods take part in every single procession from Holy Friday to Holy Saturday. They accompany "Pasos", which are statues of great artistic value. The Penitents' Procession is outstanding. It marches through the neighbourhood of San Francisco, where Flamenco verses (Saetas) are sung and the Silent Procession takes place early morning through the Old Town of Bilbao also known as Siete Calles.

 

Gipuzkoa

 

As for Azkoitia, celebrations in this town give the chance to enjoy calmness and time for thoughts. Meantime, onlookers will be able to enjoy the rich folklore though religious rituals that also include processions. Outstanding among the series of activities organised in Azkoitia on this occasion is the procession of the holy burial on Holy Friday evening, when the tomb of Christ and Our Lady of Sorrows is carried through the streets, accompanied by candles and frankincense to the beat of the "armatus" and The Funeral March. Inhabitants of coastal Hondarribia celebrate Holy Friday and Resurrection Sunday with enthusiasm. On Friday at 5pm the Parish Church witnesses the solemn procession where the Christ's descent from the cross takes place, wrapped up in a 5-m cloth. By tradition, Segura still celebrates Easter. Processions take place on Maundy Thursday and Holy Friday.

 

Álava

 

Many regions of Álava perform events and processions to recall the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ from Maundy Thursday to Resurrection Day. Among other celebrations, it is required to attend processions in Vitoria and Laguardia. Besides, on Resurrection Sunday in areas such as Salinas de Añana, Baños de Ebro and Lagrán, the "Burning of Judas" should be attended. In Moreda de Álava as well, the apostle who betrayed Jesus is burnt at the stake with Judesa, his couple. About 300 Nazarenes or penitents accompany the Silent Procession and the Holy Burial on Maundy Thursday and Holy Friday in Vitoria-Gasteiz respectively, which has been celebrated over the past four centuries. The Resurrection Day is held in the New Cathedral, where the faithful attend the blessing of palm leaves.

Farmhouse goods play the main role in the fair Okondo.

Those visitors who approach Alava's area will have the chance to get some of the best products such as legumes, vegetables, sausages, goods from the butcher's shop, honey, tinned food, pâté, wine, cider, bread, sweets and cheese, produced by local producing companies.

There will also be room for txosnas -temporary bars- and stalls displaying handicrafts. The programme also includes music performances, rural sports exhibitions (herri-kirolak) and Basque dance shows. To sum up, this is a brilliant way to get familiar with the traditional rural life.

datosGenerales.nombre: Flowers and Plants Spring Fair in Segura
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Gardening and botany enthusiasts are in luck as every year, the town of Segura holds the Plants and Flowers Spring Fair.

Several stands will display garden flowers and plants, indoor and outdoor plants, and even fruit trees.

What is more, stalls will also be spread out in the old quarter of Segura. Handicrafts, typical local products such as honey, cheese and talo, Basque food made of corn flour and water.

galeria.titulo: Flowers and Plants Spring Fair in Segura

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The inhabitants of Errenteria celebrate their annual meeting with Mount San Marcos by means of a traditional procession. The event takes place on the occasion of San Marcos Day (April 25th) but is held the previous or the following Sunday.

 

In the surroundings of San Marcos shelter in Mount Bizarain, on such special day as this, godmothers cook special cakes known as "opillak" for their single godsons.

Taking the body as subject, between 21st September and 1th December it holds XXIV. Dantzaldia Fest in several stages distributed all over Bilbao.

 

An international event with dancing being the star, and an open window to many different trends and artists by La Fundición´s initiative and the collaboration of some other cultural spots as Azkuna Zentroa, Sala Rekalde…

 

An endless number of activities in a program with new creations, new looks, cinema, workshops and meetings with the creators are waiting for you in this 22nd Dantzaldia Fest Edition.

The town of Laguardia (in Alava) celebrates the “Bag-piper Day”. Bagpipers' from all over Spain will be attending apart from performers from Alava.

Concerts, dance festivals, contest of song writing and recovering, dartboards, and music parades are part of the activities making up the events bound to take place throughout the day.

Do not forget that Laguardia was the birthplace of bagpipers and players of dulzaina -double reed instrument-, and that the town is the perfect setting to listen to the echoes of this instrument down the streets.

datosGenerales.nombre: Día del baserritarra in Mungia (Farmer's Day)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Día del baserritarra (Farmer's Day) is a total tribute to the rural world.

Included in the activities' programme of San Pedro festivity in Mungia, farm produce will be displayed in Plaza de los Fueros Square and Calle Askatasuna Street, as well as an exhibition and a tasting of fungi and mushrooms with the Mycology Association of Mungia.

Trikitilaris (players of trikitixa), a two-row Basque diatonic button accordion- and txistularis (players of txistu), a kind of fipple flute- will be livening up the atmosphere. Besides, Parque Torrebillela Park has been the setting selected to hold an exhibition of autochthonous and exotic animals and for those who want to ride, they will have ponies and horses at their disposal, ideal for a family plan.

What is more, Gizaberri Elkartasun Taldea will be the association in charge of arranging a small fair where second-hand books will be on sale. In the evening, once the fair comes to an end, there will be a gymkhana for the inhabitants of Mungia, a popular meal, a local rock bands' contest and a theatre performance in Plaza Matxin Plaza.

Zumaia flysch Trail mountain race, which will count towards the Euskadi Cup. All visitors and runners who come to this town in Gipuzkoa will have the opportunity to enjoy a day full of sport and beauty in the spectacular cliffs between Zumaia and Deba.

The race will be far from easy. Participants will have to tackle a distance of 15 kilometres with a maximum elevation of 240 metres or 23 kilometres and a maximum elevation of 231 metres.

The race will not be easy at all. The runners departing from Erribera kale must face 27 km and an slope measuring 1,640 metres. The physical effort will get its moral reward, though.

San Roke fiestas include "Baserritar Eguna" (Farmer's Day) on August 28th in the activities' programme, a complete homage to the rural world. Thus, from 9am on an exhibition and buy of farm produce with txakoli and cider tastings as well as pintxos made of meat will be available. Dulzaineros (players of dulzaina, a double reed instrument), trikitilaris (trikitixa players, a two-row Basque diatonic button accordion) and txistularis (players of txistu, a kind of fipple flute).

 



To carry on with the programme, Plaza de Lamuza Square will be the setting for an exhibition of rural sports,  giving way to Basque dances, later on.

Astigarraga is a town with strong ties to cider; not surprisingly, along with Hernani, it is considered to be the birthplace of this beverage.

 

So, all those who make their way to Astigarraga can have a taste of the first apple juice, as well as contemplating, in situ, the process of how it is made. The festival coincides with the start of the apple pressing and it is this fruit that is the focus of all activities.

 

Highlights of the programme are the exhibition and sale of various products (native apples, cider, apple jelly ...) and several demonstrations.

galeria.titulo: The apple is the focus of all activities

datosGenerales.descripcion:
On 1st November, cheese will be the undisputed main attraction in Turtzioz. Another year and the municipality of las Encartaciones region is celebrating the Cheese Fair, which in previous years has brought together hundreds of people. There will be a multitude of stalls filling the streets of Turtzioz, that will make top quality agricultural produce available to visitors at the fair.

 

There will also be a tasting where visitors will be able to taste various products (such as for example, various types of cheeses and txakoli wine) and there will be craft stalls. Similarly, a competition is being organized to choose the best cheese, the best Basque cake, the best bread and the best stall. In short, this is a day devoted to cheese and some of the most emblematic produce in our land.

galeria.titulo: The cheese will be the main protagonist

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The San Sebastián Gastronomika - Euskadi Basque Country congress, consolidated as a world reference in haute cuisine, returns to the Kursaaal for another year.  This year it celebrates its 25th anniversary with many surprises. In this edition, the kitchens of Japan and the United States will play a special role.

 

This year, the Tribute Award will go to Ferran Adrià, the Golden Gueridon to Jancis Robinson and the Pau Albornà y Torras Journalism Award to Rafael García Santos.

 

Registration is open and apart from being able to attend in person, it can be seen live and/or deferred on its official website.

Eating snails at Christmas time is a deeply rooted tradition in many Basque homes. Several days before, on the first Saturday of December to be precise, Gernika-Lumo dedicates a day to the mentioned mollusc.

 

Thus, everyone approaching town will have the chance to taste portions of snails previously cooked in different ways such as "Biscayan style". Stands will display varied goods such as fruit and vegetables, Basque cake, bread, yoghurt, honey or pâté, among others. The fair completes with an exhibition of euskal dantzak (Basque dances) and children's activities.

galeria.titulo: Snails play the main role in the fair

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Considered the "wine capital", Laguardia feels Christmas time in a special way. This it to a large extent due to the spectacular articulated crib that every year is installed in the Church of Santa María de los Reyes.

 

This is one of the few Baroque cribs in motion at present that draws the visitors' and locals' attention.

 


Representations:

  • December 25th
  • January 1 and 6
  • February 6th

For more information contact Laguardia Tourist Office (945 600 845).

datosContacto.direccion: Iglesia de Santa María de los Reyes

datosGenerales.descripcion:
As every year, Salinas de Añana will commemorate the history of the Valle Salado (Salt Valley) by holding the Salt Fair.

 

There will be dramatised visits, bowls competitions, a salt crafts fair, music and a popular meal throughout the weekend.

galeria.titulo: The Salt Fair of Salinas de Añana

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Azkuna Zentroa will again host the Gutun Zuria International Literary Festival, a meeting point for local, national and international writers with the general public, thanks to the informal talk format open to conversation.

 

In these 11 editions of the Festival renowned contemporary literary figures have taken part, such as Salman Rushdie, Chuck Palahniuk, John Verdon, Herta Múller and Gao Xingjian.

The Ehunmilak trail mountain race will be held over three days, on 12th, 13th and 14th July, and will cross through the Gipuzkoan regions of Goierri, Tolosaldea, Urola Kosta, Urola Garaia and Debagoiena. The trail, which begins and ends in Beasain, covers a course of 168 kilometres.

The "Goierriko2Haundiak" race (88 kilometres) and "Murumendi (42,195km), both of them covering a shorter distance, will take place at the same time.

datosContacto.direccion: Salida y llegada: Ayuntamiento de Beasain

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Retro Clásica Bilbao, the Classic, Vintage and Collection Vehicle Trade Fair, will celebrate a new edition from 15 to 17 November in the BEC in Barakaldo.

The event will feature hundreds of display stands, and there will be exhibitions of classic vehicles and motorcycles, accessories, spare parts and related items. The events schedule will include activities such as rallies, gatherings, display stands and exhibitions related to the classic automobile sector.

item.value:
Renowned artists such as Wild Beasts, Lori Meyers, Toy, The Wombats, El Columpio Asesino, Kokoshca, Reptile Youth,... will perform at the fourth edition of the Kutxa Kultur festival, dedicated to independent music.

The event will be staged at the theme park in Igeldo.

The programme will also feature the participation of ten local groups.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Hondarribia will be the stage for the fifth edition of the International Medieval Pintxo and Tapa Competition.

Seven chefs from Almazán, Estella-Lizarra, Hondarribia, Jerez de los Caballeros, Laguardia, Sigüenza and Marvâo (Portugal) will take part. Their dishes can be tasted in 7 establishments in Hondarribia, from 12:30h to 15:30h.

The best of miniature cuisine!

datosGenerales.nombre: Gau Zuria. White Night in Bilbao
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Gau Zuria, the White Night is the event organized to celebrate Bilbao´s “birthday”. This year, Bilbao celebrates the 724th anniversary of its foundation and the events that have been organized will take place during two very special nights.

Between 14 and 15 of June, light and sound performances, theatre, music, video mapping and sensory experiences have been prepared as part of a tour, in which the attendees will have to be attentive to every corner of Bilbao.

An extensive programme that allows you to stroll around Bilbao with different eyes, enjoying the creations of local and international artists. Gau Zuria´s shows will be distributed throughout various areas of the capital, including the  Fine Arts Museum, Azkuna Zentroa and Arriaga Theatre.

Street performances, contemporary dance, circus and puppets come together at the Kalealdia street arts festival.

The event will take place around the Gran Vía in Bilbao and at several venues in the Old Town, such as Plaza Nueva, Plaza Arriaga and the Arenal Pier. Many companies will take part in this festival.

Community centres in Vitoria-Gasteiz will host the Auzo Eszena programme, offering 7 shows.

The circus, flamenco dancing, comedy or clown shows all have their space in this edition of Auzo Eszena.

item.value: As part of the Christmas programme in theatres across Álavas capital, 12 shows will be performed, including concerts, a zarzuela, theatre and dance productions, stand-up comedy acts... Some of the shows which stand out in particular include the Fito y Fitipaldis concert (1st December), the La revoltosa zarzuela (14th December) and the Eoloh circus show (21st-23rd December) at the Teatro Principal; the performance by Pepín Tre at the Félix Petite (14th December); and the award-winning play "Mejorcita de lo mío" (20th December), which will be performed at the Teatro Jesús Ibáñez de Matauco.
Theatres Principal Antzokia, Félix Petite and Jesús Ibáñez de Matauco

Theatres Principal Antzokia, Félix Petite and Jesús Ibáñez de Matauco
Link to the tourism website of the Vitoria-Gasteiz City Council

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Ribera Market (Riverside Market), located next to the ría de Bilbao in the Old Town, is one of the most important trade centres in Bilbao and Biscay. The San Antón Bridge is nearby the Riverside Market, whose surroundings have become an important economic centre.

 

The history of this market goes back to the 14th century, though the building we know today was opened in 1929. Since then it has been refurbished several times; in 1984 it had to be extensively rebuilt following the flood of 1983.

 

In 1990 Guinness recognized Riverside market as the most complete one, being the biggest roofed market in Europe.

 

The ground floor is devoted to fish products; at the first floor, there are all the stalls selling meat; and finally, the second floor is the place for fruit and vegetables.

 

In addition, La Ribera Market completes its gastronomic offer with restaurants, bars and gastrobars, in which ham, seafood and gildas can be tasted or the best live jazz can be enjoyed.

As it names suggests, this market is situated in Plaza del Ensanche, just off the Gran Vía (Bilbao's main commercial and financial artery). It was built during the urban expansion of the 19th century, between the streets Colón de Larreategui and Henao.

 

Remodelled in 2003, today the market building is a combination of tradition and modernity. Its 10 stalls sell typical local produce ranging from fruit and vegetables to meat and fish. The building also houses various cultural and information offices dedicated to the city, while the central space (1,053 square metres) will be used to host events and as a gathering place.

Dock of the Bay, the Musical Documentary Film Festival of San Sebastián, will feature, once again, an extensive programme of activities.

Trueba cinemas, Tabakalera and Teatro Principal will screen the films, and there will also be exhibitions, concerts and screenings at a variety of venues.

datosContacto.direccion: Cines Trueba, Tabakalera, Antzoki Zaharra / Teatro Principal

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Each month, the traditional Mercado de la Almendra (this translates directly as the "Almond Market") is held in Vitoria-Gasteiz's old town. The market takes its name from Vitoria-Gasteiz's oval-shaped medieval quarter, which was declared a Monument Site in 1997.

 

It is held on the first Saturday of each month, and is divided up into a series of rutas, or routes. The Ruta del Comercio, or Shopping Route, extends over Cuchillería street and San Francisco street, the Burullería Plaza, Correría street and the Santo Domingo plaza, and attracts many sellers and craftsmen, who take advantage of the opportunity to offer all types of products for sale, while the Ruta Cultural, or Cultural Route, gives visitors the chance to explore the medieval quarter by going on a guided tour.

 

In addition, under the slogan, The secrets of the Almond, a market seller invites Vitoria-Gasteiz natives and visitors alike to come and learn all about his job. We mustn't forget to mention the Ruta de las Barricas, or Barrel Route, which involves touring around bars to enjoy a pintxo (delicious, Basque-style tapas) or a pote (a small glass of wine), all for a modest price.

 

Two information stands are erected on market days: one is located on San Francisco street and the other can be found at the Burullería plaza, which is also home to the "Children's Corner", with its workshops, games and handicrafts for youngsters.

The traditional fair in Ordizia every Wednesday is a meeting place for buyers and sellers of agricultural produce from the area.

 

It is sheltered by a structure with thick columns, and has numerous stalls of all kinds: Idiazabal cheese, fruit, vegetables and endless top-quality fresh produce.

 

As well as the weekly market, Ordizia hosts a range of important fairs throughout the year. On Wednesday in Easter week, for example, Artzain Eguna is celebrated, an occasion to present Idiazabal cheese. The special Basque Festivities market is held in September, and December sees the special Christmas market. 

 

The fair in Ordizia has always stood out as a firm defender of seasonal local produce. In line with this, the idea is to showcase one seasonal product every month, for which purpose a space is provided in the square, to be occupied every Wednesday by the different stallholders selling this product at the fair.

 

As well as this, on the last Wednesday of every month there is a gastronomic demonstration involving the guest product.

The famous weekly market in Tolosa is held in three open-air spaces: At the Tinglado marketplace, in the old town, local farmers (or baserritarras in Basque) come here every Saturday to sell their freshest products; at the Verdura plaza, a flower and plants fair is held every week; foreign and textile products are sold at the Euskal Herria plaza.

This market, one of the most important in the Basque Country, has more than 760 years of history. Since 1256, it has been the meeting point for traders and consumers, the perfect place to buy typical products brought directly from the market gardens of the nearby farmhouses.

Tolosa beans, piparras or chilli peppers from Ibarra, Idiazabal cheese, apples from Errezil, all kinds of vegetables and even homemade bread and pastries are some of the star products that you can buy if you visit the market.

Located in the centre of San Sebastian, it features a wide variety of shops and other establishments.

The new San Martín market has restored some of the characteristic features of the old building: the central street, a walkway covered by a ten-metre-wide roof, and the large expanse of glass on its facades. Visitors will be greeted with traditional market stands that are well-lit, spacious, and designed using the highest-quality materials. Local fruit, vegetables, meats and fish are on sale at the stands.

San Martín Market also boasts a supermarket, several clothes shops, a music shop, a full-size gym and coffee shops.

The sixth edition of Bilbao Art District, the longest Art Week, will fill Bilbao with creativity. It aims to promote art in the capital of the Biscay region.

 

This year it will last 10 days, from May 2 to 12, and many different streets and locations in the city will embrace this creativity and art exhibition.

 

The programme includes tons of activities, plans, exhibitions, conferences and meetings with artists, as well as real-time creations on the street.

 

The estuary of Bilbao will be one of the main exhibition locations, as many of the urban artistic interventions will be visible from the estuary banks.

 

Apart from the estuary, the Bilbao Fine Arts Museum, the Guggenheim Bilbao Museum and the Euskalduna Conference Hall are other locations that will take part in this event.

 

A week full of concerts, shows and artistic activities.

This Easter Week sees a new edition of BasqueFest. This festival is a celebration aimed at anybody who wants to get to know Basque culture, especially those visiting Bilbao in Easter Week on holiday.

The BasqueFest programme is made up of displays of strength and skill in country sports, such as stone-lifting (harri jasotzea), woodcutting competitions (aizkolaritza) and rock drilling (harri zulaketa). This is counterpointed with the elegance and agility of Basque dancing, and fun and good spirits in music. All of it accompanied by the finest Basque food and the work of top Basque designers. A new addition this year will be film.

Like this, Easter Week in Bilbao is not just a setting for religious processions and traditions, but also a time to liven up the city with Basque culture in its widest sense.

A traditional market is held every Monday throughout the year in the municipality of Gernika-Lumo, in the plaza del mercado. More than 100 local producers gather here to sell fruit, vegetables, cheeses, flowers, plants, and more.

 

It is also worth mentioning that on the first Saturday of every month, between June and December, specialist markets are held; these include the Idiazabal cheese and Urdaibai txakoli day, the Gernika pepper day and the cod and Rioja Alavesa wine day.

 

This Biscayan village is above all famous for its special markets on the first and last Monday of October, specially on the last one, when the market and the festive atmosphere invade the whole village. The event attracts thousands of people from throughout the Basque Country.

Located in the Old Town of San Sebastián, La Bretxa Market has a privileged setting.

 

At the basement of La Bretxa shopping centre, there are more than forty retailers, selling fruit, vegetables, canned goods, delicatessen products, meats and fish.

 

The farmers' stalls are located outside and sell vegetables, flowers and cheese.

Chefs from the Basque Autonomous Community anda  Navarre  will compete once again at this year's Euskal Herria Pintxos Championships.

 

This year's addition will feature a public judging panel in addition to the customary professional panel.

datosGenerales.nombre: World Press Photo exhibition in Vitoria-Gasteiz
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The most important photojournalist international contest, World Press Photo, returns another autumn to Vitoria-Gasteiz.

 

In this edition, works from the best international agencies and well-known journalism figures are exhibited in the city's former water tank attached to the Montehermoso Cultural Centre.

 

From 14th October to 13th November will take place in Vitoria-Gasteiz this annual event, unavoidable for enthusiasts, professionals and people curious about photography.

galeria.titulo: Winning photo: Amber Bracken (source: official website)

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Discover the Uribe region and taste some of the local delicacies at a series of Euskadi Gastronomika establishments.

 

All of the establishments that have joined this tourism club have designed special menus based on the local products.

 

You can also learn how the products are made and participate in a variety of culinary activities, such as pintxo workshops and tastings.

Amorebieta-Etxano (Bizkaia Province) is to host Mangamore 2021.

 

 Visitors to the festival will have access to a wide range of activities, including workshops on manga drawing, Japanese makeup, dubbing into Basque and karate; opportunities to sample Japanese and Basque cuisine (including local pintxos or tapas); a dog meet for the Akita and Shiba Inu breeds; music with Kokeshi, Zaparrada Batukada and Eromen; karaoke; a kimono show; and a variety of exhibitions.

 

All this and more can be experienced at the Zelaieta cultural centre.

Getxo prepares himself one more year to receive the Surfing Party, Punta Galea Challenge, returns one more year to the Biscay coast.

Punta Galea Challenge is one of the 7 that form parto f the prestigious World Circuito f Big Waves of Surfing, Big Wave Tour, being this one the only one of them that are organized in European territory.

Musika-Música is an International Festival of Classical Music held every year in Bilbao. The outstanding feature of this Festival is its themed nature, as every year the performances focus on a specific period, style or composer. This year, the axis of the festival will be "notes and letters".

 

Every year it attracts large numbers of top-flight performers and orchestras from a wide variety of places to the Palacio Euskalduna.  Alongside the numerous professional performances, the Festival, also features students from various conservatories.

The 17th March Rioja Alavesa will be holding the Álava olive oil fair. Full day with activities and events in  Moreda. The event is to be a great opportunity to get to know the world of olive trees and olive oil in the area.

Visitors will have the chance to try tasting this year’s oil on toast, attend tastings of local oils and more. They can also buy produce from the area and see themed exhibitions, and children’s workshops will be run for the smallest members of the family.

On the Sunday after San Isidro, Zalla celebrates Wine Day.

The aim of this day is to present the new harvest to all the inhabitants of this town and to all visitors. The event will bring together almost twenty producers who will offer more than 600 litres of their wines accompanied by pintxos of local products prepared by a local society.

As always, the only requirement will be the purchase of a commemorative glass of the edition and with which you will be able to pass through all the stands.

Break On Stage celebrates a new edition. This year it has been moved to Barakaldo, a town that will host fantastic urban performances by hundreds of artists. Break On Stage performances will start early in the afternoon.

 

There will be different kinds of performances including urban dancing, music and sports: breakdance, scooter, bmx, urban dance, parkou, beat-box and Cyr Wheel.

 

The best international breakdance in Euskadi (Basque Country), a classic for hip-hop lovers.

The Bilbao Triathlon is a well-established event in the city’s sports calendar. The event is held in Half and Olympic distances.

 

The Middle or Half Distance is made up of a 1,900 metres swim, 86 kilometres on bike and a 21 kilometre run; whereas the Olympic Distance for the same event will be 1,500 meters, 36,5 and 10 kilometres.

The ZarauzkoTriatloia is a top-class sporting event. will gather more than fifty participants on a single day.

Its route, which sets out from the neighbouring locality of Getaria, includes 2,9 km of swimming, 78km of cycling circuit and 21 km running.

Every Holy Week, Balmaseda, a town near Bilbao, hosts a presentation of the Stations of the Cross (Via Crucis) performed by residents of the town. Currently, more than 700 people participate in this extraordinary tradition, which has been preserved for centuriesand which attracts thousands of visitors to Balmaseda every year.

 

Although some writers state that it dates back to 1480, when a plague epidemic devastated the town, there are no documents confirming its existence until 1771, when the “Holy Week and Corpus Christi Processions” are mentioned in municipal documents for the first time.

 

In the 19th century, new elements such as the ‘penitents’ or ‘Nazarenes’ (as they are called in Spain), the ‘Pharisees’ or soldiers of the Roman guard were introduced, and they have become some of the most distinctive elements even today. In the last decade of the 19th century, the main protagonist of Holy Week, Jesus of Nazareth (the ‘Nazarene’), is mentioned for the first time. It is only from this moment on that this tradition can be referred to as a living representation of the Passion of Jesus. In 1963, the ‘Crucifixion’ was included in the representation, and is undoubtedly the high point of the performance.

Hondarribia experiences Easter Week in a very special way. Good Friday and Easter Sunday conserve ancient rituals in which the population takes part in large numbers.

 

At five in the afternoon on Friday the parish church fills up with a congregation eager to see the solemn taking down of the crucifix. On Easter Sunday the procession of the resurrection or ‘ttopara’ is held.

 

This is documented as far back as1602, though there is reason to believe it is much older. Today, the tradition preserves a distinctive character of its own which makes it unique and delights visitors, especially during the Good Friday procession.

datosGenerales.nombre: Journeys by steam train in Azpeitia
datosGenerales.descripcion:
This Easter Week onwards the Basque Railway Museum in Azpeitia (Gipuzkoa province) will be running special services on a historic train pulled by a steam locomotive.

The locomotive Aurrera, the last in a series built between 1892 and 1898 and restored in 1991 by the museum itself, will be back on the track to carry passengers in a travel through time.

The Basque Railway Museum presents one of the finest railway collections in Europe, with locomotives of all kinds, wagons, clocks and fully restored and working historic electrical installations.

datosAgenda.horario:
Saturdays: Departures at 10:30 and 18:00

Sundays and Bank Holidays: Departures at 12:30

The service will remain active until November 3.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The mediaeval market in Balmaseda goes back to 1999, when the town celebrated the eight hundredth anniversary of its foundation, the first of its kind in Bizkaia.

 

Its extraordinary staging makes this market a landmark on the Basque cultural scene. The population throws itself into the event, donning period costume in a setting filled with standards and banners, with the streets filled with straw, plunging visitors into the mediaeval atmosphere of the days when Balmaseda’s trading activities earned it the category of a ‘Villa’, or town.

 

The activities, in which some 400 townspeople take part as actors, include musicians, jugglers, street performers and acrobats who fill the streets of the old town to announce the opening of the market, the centre of which is in the Plaza de San Severino. Not forgetting the falconers, of course, and the occasional snake charmer to be found in some corner of the town. The Plaza de San Severino hosts glass blowing workshops and craftsmen, potters and smiths, as well as weavers or spinners, among others.

 

Strolling players, singers, comics, troubadours, bigheads, balancing acts and acrobats are there to be enjoyed every year at this event. The Mediaeval Market is rounded off with night-time activities in which fire and spectacle combine to delight the public.

The Azkena Rock Festival (ARF) is a rock festival held every year in Vitoria-Gasteiz which has become one of the top festivals in Spain. 

It specialises in bands which are big on the underground scene. Every year it also brings especially well-known or “legendary” names to top the bill for ARF audiences.

Azkena Rock Festival 2024 will feature performances by All Them Witches, Arde Bogotá, Band of Horses, Bonafide, Brigade Loco, Dea Matrona, Entropía and Ezpalak among many other bands.

datosContacto.direccion: Mendizabala, junto al polideportivo de Mendizorroza.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
This June the Bilbao estuary is to be the venue for a major water sports event open to all, the 7th Iberdrola Bilbao World SUP Challenge, one of the most important Stand Up Paddleboarding (SUP) events at international level.

 

The wide river dividing the city in two will be hosting the world’s top riders, who will be competing in two events: Long Distance and Sprint.

 

There will also be an amateur competition. Entry is via the website. Other events such as workshops and concerts are to be held alongside the competition.

datosGenerales.nombre: Festivities of San Pedro in Mundaka
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Mundaka is celebrating its patron saint's day as it does every year. The big day is on 29th June, though the celebrations run from 21st June to 6th July.

This period includes concerts, the band and the txozna taverns to be enjoyed, but to really get to know this beautiful town visitors should not miss the famous processions in honour of San Pedro (St. Peter), the Aurresku dance, the bagpipers, the bigheads or the "kukaña marítima" festive games.

The central event takes place on 29th June, a church mass attended by the whole corporation. The local choir will sing the Tu est Petrus. This will be followed by the Saint Peter procession with Aurresku dancing in honour of the saint and the corporation.

Les ruelles en pente de la Vieille Ville accueillent l'un des festivals locaux les plus populaires organisés autour de l’Estuaire.

La ville historique de Portugalete, située à l'entrée de l’Estuaire du Nervion, à 10 minutes de Bilbao, a été traditionnellement un lieu de rencontre festif pour les communes des deux rives.

Mais le 1er juillet est, chaque année, une journée de fête spéciale, en l'honneur de la Vierge de la Guia, la première du calendrier festif et l’une des plus appréciées de la région.

On September will take place a new edition of Sopela Kosta Fest. Following the success of previous editions, this year, apart from keeping some activities from the first one, it has many novelties.

 

The three main ingredients of the festival are still surfing, nature and music. In these 4 days it could be enjoyed a program ready to suit all tastes and age groups.

 

The festival will have two main areas: around some beaches (Arrietara-Atxabiribil beaches and Barinatxe beach) and at the Town Hall Square.

Llanada Alavesa will be hosting the 14th Gastronomic Event, which will revolve around four regional products: potatoes, wild mushrooms, cheese, bread and game.

All restaurants have created menus.

Apart from the gastronomic activities, there will be a program of cultural and sports activities for the whole family.

datosGenerales.nombre: Debagoiena Gastronomika - Debagoiena XXXII Gastronomy Fair
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Debagoiena Gastronomika, the 32nd Gastronomic Days in Debagoiena represent an unparalleled opportunity to immerse yourself in Debagoiena, to get to know our culture and to be able to taste our cuisine.

 

The aim of this gastronomic experience is to make the most of the culinary resources of Debagoiena, to make the connection between producers, processors and the restaurants themselves.

 

Various restaurants in the area will be serving special meals made using seasonal, local produce. This will be a chance to find out about the produce of the area and also to discover the varied attractions Debagoiena has to offer visitors.
