datosGenerales.nombre: FICAB. Bidasoa International Archaeological Film Festival
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Oiasso Roman Museum and Irun town council have been organising FICAB, the Bidasoa International Archaeological Film Festival, since 2001.

 

The aim of the Festival is to bring archaeology to the public through audio-visual work which stirs interest and shows the results of archaeological exploration.

 

Four prizes are awarded: the Festival Grand Prize, the Special Audience Prize, the Arkeolan Prize for academic dissemination and Orona Fundazioa Award to the Educational Section.

 

FICAB is a member of Fedarcine, the European Federation of Film Festivals on Archaeology and Cultural Heritage.

datosContacto.direccion: Museo Romano Oiasso de Irun. Eskoleta, 1

datosGenerales.nombre: Guided yours of mediaeval Vitoria-Gasteiz: The Heart of the Almond
datosGenerales.descripcion:
In Vitoria-Gasteiz the old town, of mediaeval origin, is known as “la Almendra”, which means “the almond”. In a small area which makes it easy to visit on foot, you can discover historic buildings which are perfectly preserved but keep all their character and give you an idea of what the town looked like in days gone by.

 

St. Mary’s cathedral is the most important of these buildings, but others can also be visited, including St. Michael’s church (housing the niche with the statue of Our Lady, patroness of the city), the old walls, the Casa del Cordón (mediaeval) or the renaissance-style palaces of Escoriaza Esquivel, Montehermoso and Villa Suso.

 

Upcoming dates



  • February:  Saturdays and Sundays: 11.15 am (Spanish) and 11.30 am (Basque). On the 14th and 28th of January there will also be guided tours at 11.15 am (Spanish) and 11.30 am (Basque). Fridays and Saturdays: 5:00 pm (Spanish) and 5:30 pm (Basque).
  • Marzo: Saturdays and Sundays: 11.15 am (Spanish) and 11.30 am (Basque). On the 19th and 20th of March there will also be guided tours at 11.15 am (Spanish) and 11.30 am (Basque). Fridays and Saturdays: 5:00 pm (Spanish) and 5:30 pm (Basque). Also on March 19th.

datosAgenda.horario:
During the whole year:

  • Fridays and Saturdays: 5:00 pm (Spanish) and 5:30 pm (Basque).
  • Saturdays and Sundays: 11.15 am (Spanish) and 11.30 am (Basque).

galeria.titulo: Guided yours of mediaeval Vitoria-Gasteiz: The Heart of the Almond

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The San Sebastián International Film Festival is the biggest event in San Sebastián and drives the city's close relationship with film.

 

Great names from the history of film have been linked to San Sebastián, which has also ended up seducing all those who visit it for the festival: Federico Fellini, Audrey Hepburn, Alfred Hitchcock, Jean-Luc Godard, Sophia Loren, Luis Buñuel, François Truffaut, Agnès Varda and Orson Welles, among others. 

 

Every year hundreds of films are presented in the different sections ranging from the Official Selection to New Directors, Perlak, Culinary Zinema and Zabaltegi-Tabakalera. Many of them will be competing for the prizes in the different sections, foremost among them the Golden Shell, to which the feature films in the Official Selection aspire.

 

Also, every year at the San Sebastian Film Festival the honorary Donostia Awards are presented. International stars arrive every day during the festival and often mix with the local people, tourists and visitors, kindling great expectation.

 

Javier Bardem will receive the San Sebastian International Film Festival's highest award, which recognises the career and contribution of great figures in the world of cinema

datosGenerales.descripcion:
La Lilaton, otherwise known as the Carrera Popular de Mujeres (Women's Amateur Run) will take place in San Sebastian on 5th March; registration is open to women aged 14 and over.

 

The race, which will start and finish at the Boulevard shopping centre in San Sebastian, will be 5 kilometres long, and will pass through some of the most symbolic areas in Gipuzkoa's capital, such as La Zurriola Bridge.

International Bilbao-Bilbao Cycle Touring Event has three different routes: 85km, 115km and 125 km. The race has a personality of its own which attracts many and varied participants.

There are 5 staged starts at 15-minute intervals and it is suitable for all cyclists. Over the years thousands of cyclists have taken part and enjoyed the route and their experiences along it. The starting line is at the Deusto bridge, next to the Zubiarte shopping centre, and the finish is on the Gran Vía Bilbao.

On the first Friday in May, Getaria will be hosting “Antxua Eguna” (Anchovy Day), an event that seeks to encourage people to taste anchovies and txakoli and take tours to discover the fishing industry and appreciate the people who work in it.

 

The day will include specialised activities about anchovies as well as talks, guided tours of the fish market and different canning firms, breakfast and lunch. There will also be a chance to taste grilled, fried and salted anchovies washed down with txakoli, and the musical accompaniment will be provided by dantzaris and txistularis.

 

Some of the highlights among the activities planned include tastings and music, a combination that combines culture with good food and drink.

A day dedicated to the “arrantzale” or fisherman is held every year in Getaria in honour of its local fishermen.

 

This event, known in Basque as the Arrantzale Eguna, is held on the last Sunday in May, and is organised by the Elkano fishermen’s association. There is a high mass followed by the traditional procession with the image of Nuestra Señora del Carmen (Our Lady of Mount Carmel).

 

Those about to put out to sea to catch bonito are blessed, and then there is a breakfast with retired fishermen.

FesTVal, the Vitoria-Gasteiz Television Festival, was born on 2009, and is the first festival devoted exclusively to television in all its formats: game shows, magazines, series, cultural, educational and social programmes, news, entertainment for children, young people and adults and more.

Over the years, FesTVal has brought together the most best-known personalities from the national television listings, awarding prizes to the most outstanding people on the scene.

The Plaza de España, the Palacio de Villasuso and the Teatro Principal are the venues for practically all the activities in FesTVal.

Sunday 18th April

 

FERIA DE PLANTAS Y JARDINERÍA

7th flower, plant and gardening tool fair.

 

Organisers: Garai town council, Urkiola rural development association and Trumoitte Elkartea

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Exhibition of local varieties of livestock and competition. Exhibition and sale of handicrafts and farm produce, agricultural machinery, cheese and txakoli from the region.

 

Organised by: Ayala town council

Cider competition and tasting.

Organised by: Tiñelu

The ‘Titereando en Vitoria-Gasteiz’ (‘Puppeteering in Vitoria-Gasteiz’) event will turn the city’s streets into a puppet theatre.

Panta Rhei Antzerkia presents a festive event in which a celebration of puppeteering will involve festivities, meetings and fun for all in the city of Vitoria-Gasteiz.

This international marathon features performances in a wide range of techniques, including glove, rod and shadow puppets, mask theatre and traditional marionettes, by leading companies.

datosContacto.direccion: Vitoria- Gasteiz (En diversos espacios de la Zona Centro y del Casco Histórico de la ciudad.)

datosGenerales.descripcion:
San Sebastián is a city made for running. It has countless routes beside the sea and a host of pedestrianised streets free from the noise of vehicles, making it the ideal place to run around. It's the best possible setting for outdoor running enthusiasts.

 

A city that lets you combine sport and exercise with the attractions of places like La Concha, El Peine del Viento or the pedestrian routes beside the river.

 

Running is very popular in San Sebastián, and the numerous fans and visitors can enjoy many open races that take place in the city all year round.

Tradition dictates that on the Friday before Christmas Eve fire heralds the arrival of Christmas in Vitoria-Gasteiz.

A night when the magical light of more than 15,000 candles serves to decorate the mediaeval quarter of Vitoria-Gasteiz and its main squares: Plaza del Matxete, Los Arquillos, Balconada de San Miguel, Plaza de Burullerías. The most important places in the mediaeval quarter, the walls, Los Faroles museum, the archaeology museum, the Portalón, the Torre de Doña Otxanda, the Palacio Escoriaza Esquível and the Palacio Villasuso are also decorated.

As a complement to this, all those visiting ‘Candle´s night’ will enjoy a play with music, dance and fireworks, as well as mulled-wine samples.

Traditional markets not only have the plus points of tradition and quality, but also maintain intact all their character as a meeting point, a public place where the heart of the city beats.

This is certainly true of the refurbished Vitoria-Gasteiz market, whose building and facilities have been adapted to suit today’s model of shopping and leisure, in the style of the widely-known markets of San Miguel in Madrid or La Boqueria in Barcelona.

As well as the traditional stalls which continue to offer the finest fresh produce, especially that from the farms of Alava, the market features eight gastrobars laid out around a large shared central space, a former wash house, where visitors can eat whatever they choose for themselves from the stalls and, of course, from the range on offer at the surrounding gastrobars, which includes cooked dishes, pintxo snacks, hamburgers, Mexican and Italian food, Spanish omelettes and sushi.

A place not to miss on your visit to Vitoria.

From 1st to 3th March Pavilion 2 of Bilbao Exhibition Centre (BEC) is to host a new edition of Gustoko, the Quality Artisan Food Fair,, the goal of which is "to boost the food and quality, artisan gastronomy sector".

 

The fair will have an exhibition area where the accent will be on local, quality produce. The exhibitors will display and sell their produce, as well as being able to take part in different activities such as training and information sessions, tastings, show cooking and guided tastings led by international professionals.

This March is the  Basque Coast Museum Month, an event whose main objective is to promote and recognise the importance of Basque cultural and natural heritage, along with advertising the region’s museums and all it has to offer.

Throughout the month, the centres belonging to the Basque Coast Museum Network will offer more than 100 activities, advantages and discounts: workshops for families, children's games, guided tours, free admission, etc. Just like the themes covered by the museums that form part of the network, the activities and contents will be varied, but they share the singularity and exclusivity of the proposals. Most of these plans cannot be enjoyed during the rest of the year.

Consult the programme with the detailed activities, as well as the need to book in advance or not and, where applicable, the price, although most of them are free of charge.

datosGenerales.nombre: Puntaik Punta. Hiking Festival in Debagoiena
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Puntaik Punta is the first hiking festival in the Basque Country. Elgeta will be the central point of the festival and there will be different guided along the paths of other municipalities in Debagoiena. Hiking is a great opportunity to get closer to nature, local heritage and the environment. It allows us to concurrently enjoy the landscape, practise sports and discover the historical-artistic and ethnographic heritage around us.

Puntaik Punta will offer a great range of guided routes covering different distances and difficulty levels, appropriate for different ages, in all the municipalities of the Debagoiena region. In addition to the guided routes, there will be more activities such as cultural activities, guided tours and the hiking fair, so forth.

Rioja Alavesa Wine Run, join in with the spirit of wine. The perfect choice before a walk in the mountains.Through vine surrounded paths and trails. 

With the sporting spirit that aims to protect its own culture, the International Rioja Alavesa Wine Run began. With two routes available at 20 km and 10km. An event where you can take part in an organised run through the vineyard and wineries.

This is a truly unique event, with two locations (Lanzarote and Rioja Alavesa) that bring together spectacular and varied wine growing areas. The International Rioja Alavesa Wine Run aims to promote the Rioja Alavesa and reclaim its tradition of family wineries and small century old estates at the foothills of the Cantabrian mountain range, along with their hills and secluded spots. An exceptional location that breathes tradition and beauty, joined together with sport in a unique way.

The starting point and finish line of both the races and the popular march will be located in Elciego. At the same time and next to the finish line, the Rioja Alavesa Wine and Food Products Fair can be found.

Our dear Olentzero is a charcoal burner and he often brings us the charcoal he makes in our forests to the Mirandaola forge... and you will have the opportunity to see it.

The visit begins at the Basque Iron Museum, where we will learn about the trade of the Olentzero, who is a charcoal burner. In addition, we will learn the story of Olentzero and Mari Domingi, as well as the donkey Napoleon, through a storyteller.

Next, we will go out to the Mirandaola park, in search of the olentzero. Suddenly, we will see how the olentzero comes down from the mountain with his bag and everything. Between children and adults we will have to call strongly for it to come closer to us. We'll get together with the olentzero and his assistant, the ironmonger, and all together we'll go to the forge.

The second part of the visit takes place in the Mirandaola forge. The children will have the opportunity to be with the olentzero.

The Regata del Gallo (Cockeral Regatta) is one of the referring ones of the Basque sail sport during the Christmas dates. 

The fantastic image of almost 80 cruisers sailing under the Hanging Bridge, with their colourful sails hoisted to the wind, is admired and photographed by fans.

At 12.00 on Saturday, surrounds a hundred of cruisers  will go out from the dock of Benedicta de Sestao to cross the emblematic Bridge of Biscay.

Miniature Pintxos Congress brings together top pintxo cooks. Nearly 400 attendees and 30 speakers will be turning Vitoria-Gasteiz into the capital of gastronomy from 27th October to 2nd November at the Palacio de Congresos Europa. 

 

Over 400 attendees will be coming along for a programme of activities featuring some thirty speakers. Miniature Pintxos Congress will go beyond the Palacio de Congresos Europa with a programme that sets out to open up to the city.

 

Thus, this year's event will feature the biggest pintxo bar in the world at the Iradier Arena, where the public will be able to taste these delicious creations. There is also a new edition of Miniature Kids, a series of fun workshops on fun, creative cooking, learning recipes and concepts for a healthy, balanced diet.

 

Miniature Pintxos Congress is organised by the Euskadi Gastronomika product club.

 

Further information and registration: http://miniature.eus/

datosContacto.direccion: Palacio de Congresos y exposiciones Europa

datosGenerales.nombre: Berdeago, the Basque environmental sustainability fair
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Berdeago, the Basque environmental sustainability fair, is an event that brings together stakeholders connected with sustainability and is held every year in Durango. The fair has become a dynamic force in the main sustainability-related sectors.

 

Berdeago provides a landmark space for areas like responsible consumption and energy (Berdeago Energy), and an extra weekend of a fair that brings together exhibitors connected with certified organic products and natural products (Berdeago Nature).

The Romería de San Juan of Bermeo is a religious festivity held every year for the Nativity of Saint John the Baptist on 24th July. It begins with a procession on foot to the chapel of San Juan de Gaztelugatxe to keep a promise or to give thanks.

It concludes with a floral offering to Our Lady of Begoña under the sea, beneath the natural arches of the island of Aketze. Pure magic, mystery and spectacle.

The stations of the cross overlooking the Bay of Biscay, with 241 steps.

The Gipuzkoan town of Pasaia will host the III  edition of the Maritime Festival between May 9 and 12 of 2024, an international maritime cultural event which, every two years, brings together traditional wooden boats with heritage value from different corners of the world.

The mere contemplation of the bay full of boats, sails and rigging is a unique spectacle, well worth a visit. In addition, Pasaia Itsas Festibala offers the opportunity to visit the deck and the interior of the large participating boats, you can cross the bay sailing among sailboats of all sizes and enjoy the culture, gastronomy, the seafaring atmosphere and the crafts located on both sides of the bay.

Pasaia Itsas Festibala is a must for lovers of the sea, culture and heritage.

One Friday a month, starting October 31, 2008, the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao hosts a night of music and art. Visit the exhibitions from 22:00 p.m. to 01:00 a.m. to the beat of the best artists from Spain and around the world in the Museum Atrium.

 

Art & Music at the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao – don’t miss out. Limited capacity. Ages 18 and older. ID or passport required.

The Open House initiative is coming to Bilbao, and doing it on a grand scale, opening up as many as 26 buildings - which are usually closed to the public - for a weekend.

 

Bilbao City hall, Fine Arts Museum and Arriaga Theater, among others, will be opening their doors free of charge to welcome anybody who wants to come along.

 

The visits consist of guided tours lasting about 20-30 minutes per building in groups.

Bizkaia is to be part of the latest European Heritage Days, a programme to promote cultural heritage, in October. "Ondarea bizirik. Patrimonio vivo!" is this year's chosen theme.

 

In squares, theatres, frontón courts, arenas and passages, in music kiosks and church doorways, music, dance, games, sports and processions invite you, as they do every year, to discover Bilbao's heritage.

Enjoy one of our most deeply-rooted Christmas traditions by visiting the traditional nativity scenes in Vitoria-Gasteiz.

Vitoria-Gasteiz offers a tour on which the highlight is the monumental nativity scene in La Florida park, with over 50 years of history behind it. The monumental nativity scene in the Parque de la Florida features more than 200 figures and is unique in the world.

You can also see others such as that at the parish church of "Colegio Sagrado Corazión, "Casa del Cordón" or Villa Suso Palace.

datosGenerales.nombre: Be surprised by the traditional nativity scenes in Bilbao
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Bilbao: During the festive season, as many as 13 nativity scenes in different formats and styles can be seen at Bilbao's Museo de Pasos.

 

This museum is located right in the center of Bilbao's Old Town. In Bilbao the church of San Nicolás, the cathedral of Santiago, the diocesan museum of sacred art, the Ribera Market, the Basque Museum, Ría de Bilbao's Maritime Museum and the Pasos museum have 51 nativity scenes on public display, made up of nearly 800 handmade figures.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Spanish Machine Tool Biennial has reached its 32nd edition. Following the success of previous years it sets out to offer the most advanced technical solutions and opts for active participation by both exhibitors and visitors.

 

This year it will have a new section to complement what is on offer and link it to Industry 4.0: industrial digitalization

The most transgressor cinema arrives once again in the Biscayan capital.

 

Now in its seventeeth edition, Zinegoak, the Bilbao International Gay-Lesbo-Trans Film an Performing Arts Festival is being will take place at various locations and venues in the Biscayan capital such the Bilborock Hall, BilbaoArte and The Golem Cinemas.

datosContacto.direccion:
BilboRock: Muelle de La Merced, 1
BilbaoArte: Urazurrutia, 32
Cines Golem: Plaza Arrikibar, 4

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Leioa´s Umore Azoka, Festival of Comedy Street Theatre will offer for four days the best street theatre performances in any point of street of the town. More than 50 companies and more than 100 acts it will make us enjoy the theater in the pure state with fantastic live spectacles.

Umore Azoka bets by the originality, with a fusion of experience and youth. A unique showcase to enjoy the theater 24 hours per day and the best acrobatics and musical performances of European panorama.

datosGenerales.nombre: Atlantikaldia, the meeting between culture and music festival
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Between the 19th and 22nd of September, Atlantikaldia, the meeting between culture and music festival that was born in 2014 with the objective of recovering the maritime memory of Errenteria and making it known to the world, will take place.

 

Atlantikaldia is in evolution and has done so in two directions: on the one hand, it has encouraged influencers from other places to bring their news and discoveries every year, at the same time, it recovers and brings to light olds traditions, enriching the local identity.

 

Within Atlantikaldia there is a music festival called “Conversaciones Marítimas” (Maritime Conversations) which will offer unique moments thanks to the cooperation between guest and local artist, creating special and unrepeatable shows for all audiences.

BBK Bilbao Music Legends Festival is back with the most authentic and energetic rhythms of great legends of rock, folk, blues, … that will flood the Bilbao Arena.

A festival with great names of the national and international music scene among which we can find Deep Purple, The Pretenders, Blues Pills...

In addition to the concerts, the BBK Bilbao Music Legends Festival offers different creative and gastronomic spaces for all audiences.

One more year, the BIME festival returns, a great festival with two approaches: its "pro" version aimed at presentations by professionals in the sector, which will be held at the Bilbao Arena, and its "live" side, the BIME Live that will take place at the Euskalduna Palace, with the concerts being the real stars. Groups such as  Anna Majidson, Ifi Ude, Gianluca and Chini Png  lead the bill, among others. 

 

Two dates with relevant national and international artists of current music, which have made this festival one of the largest  music festivals in Europe.

CIMASUB, International Cycle of Underwater Film of San Sebastián will be held in its 47th edition on 16, 17 and 18 November.

 

Organized by the Section of Underwater Activities of the Royal Society of Soccer, its aim is to make the underwater world known and accessible to all.

 

There will be a photography competition open to everyone and also a documentary competition that will be held in three categories: short, medium and long films.

 

An event that will take you on a journey through the underwater paradise.

On a magical stage with perfect scale and acoustics, such as the outdoor amphitheatre of the Caves of Pozalagua, the Music Festival of the same name will be held on summer.

2 days to enjoy music and dance in an impressive place with free admission.

Dantz is an electronic music festival with its epicentre in the Egia district of San Sebastián, with Tabakalera and Gasteszena as the main venues, and a programme that extends to various clubs around the city.

 

Dantz is a festival that combines international sounds with local ones, taking special care to make sure women artists have a presence. To do this, it is based on an open way of working, in cooperation with different groups, institutions and venues, with an editorial policy that comes out in the look, in the programme and, in short, in its essence.

 

The Dantz 2019 programme features, among other things: Actriq, Aitor Etxebarria (El Txef_A), Oscar Mulero, Parallax, Reykjavik606 & Inesfera, Sega Sound Killers, Tuber and Vacuum Exploration.

datosAgenda.fechaOrientativa: Coming soon on sale on the official website

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Next 21st of October will mark theTotalEnergies Bilbao Night Marathon, in which runners from all 5 continents will participate.

 

A race that offers the participants three different homologated distances: 42K, 21K and 10K, which will start at the San Mamés Stadium and end at the Guggenheim Museum.

 

The event is open to athletes over 18 years of age, federated, unfederated and from any nationality.

 

A two-lap course approved by RFEA that will run entirely on asphalt, where athletes will cross the main streets of Bilbao: Gran Vía, Guggenheim, Palacio Euskalduna, Parte Vieja, Teatro Arriaga, Ayuntamiento, Puente Calatrava, Torres Isozaki…

 

Without a doubt, an urban race through the main streets of Bilbao where runners can enjoy  the sport and live performances, fireworks and the warmth of thousands of fans.

datosGenerales.nombre: Exhibition: ABC. The alphabet of the Bilbao Museum
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Bilbao Fine Arts Museum celebrates its 110 birthdays with the alphabetical exhibition “ABC. The alphabet of the Bilbao Museum” as a finishing touch. 

In this exhibition the habitual explanatory criterio of arrangement of the Works (chronological, authors…) are replaced with an alphabet of 31 letters, which include Basque double letters like ts, tx and tz, in addition to the ll of the Spanish alphabet. 

The basque writer and poet Kirmen Uribe, has been who has designed an itinerary composed by letters and words in four languages Basque, Spanish, English and French; that covers the art history and the collection across diverse periods and styles. 

The exhibition The alphabet of the Bilbao Museum that occupies 31 rooms of the renewed ancient building emphasizes the wealth and variety of the collection of the museum that it includes principally from the XIIIth century until our days.

galeria.titulo: ABC. The alphabet of the Bilbao Museum

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Between the 17 and 19 of October, the performances of the groups chosen to participate in the “Villa de Bilbao” Pop-Rock Competition Final 2019 will take place in the Bilborock Hall.

 

31st edition of the contest brings together 3 groups that will be measured in the Pop-Rock (Go Cactus, Beluga and Wicked Wizzard), 3 bands in the Urban (Colectivo Shumareli, JazzWoman and Kenna I) and 3 in the metal (The Blind Eye, Last Dissonance and Deriva). The winning bands will be decided on the basis of the votes of the jury and the public.

Mazoka, the Drawing and Illustration Festival of Vitoria-Gasteiz, is a graphic festival where drawing and illustration lovers could enjoy unquestionable technical, artistic and creative high-quality works which show new values in this field, national and international.

 

During the weekend and Mazoka´s graphic festival itself, it will take place different parallel activities related to drawing and illustration, musical performances, workshops, talks, demonstrations.

datosContacto.direccion: Antiguo Depósito de Aguas, Centro Cultural Montehermoso

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Kantauri Fest is the biggest boats gathering in Bizkaia. Tens of boats, launches, rowing boats, skiffs… are taking Zierbena Port the first weekend of October. 

 

An unparalleled display you could join using your own boat or standing in the port itself, tasting an excellent shellfish appetizer or participating in many activities, having always the best music as a backdrop.

 

A weekend when sea lovers could have the opportunity to enjoy the excellent boat parade, activities for children, the marmitako contest, and wine and culinary tastings, among other activities.

datosGenerales.nombre: Ja! Bilbao - International Festival of Literature and Art with Humour
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Ja! Bilbao is an International Festival of Literature and Art with Humour where it emphasizes that the arts in general, joined to the humour can be understood about better way.

This festival that began in 2010 brings to the city a wide activities program for all the ages and with free access until complete capacity and account with the presence of big figures.

Every year, through the BBK Ja! Bilbao Award, the festival honors to an international personality. The winners so far have been: Tom Sharpe, Francisco Ibáñez, Ísmail Kadaré (in an edition on humor against barbarism), Robert Crumb, Julian Barnes, Fernando Trueba, John Cleese, Joyce Carol Oates and Álex de la Iglesia.

International Unseen Film Festival, “Filme Sozialak”, brings over to the public the social realities marginalized on the conventional screens.

 

A festival that shows us a cinema replete with diversity and social commitment and that for this edition has selected 84 works of 50 countries to contest distributed in different categories: Equity of Genre, Human rights, Interculturality or Sustainable development.

 

The festival will take place between the 18th and 25th of October, being provided with projections in more than 24 head offices distributed in Biscay.

datosGenerales.nombre: Gatzaren Eguna – Day of the Salt
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Next May 19, there will be celebrated a new edition of “Gatzaren Eguna” (Day of the Salt) in Leintz Gatzaga. One day in which it will be possible to enjoy a wide activities program in addition to visiting the Salt Museum.

It will be in the fronton of the municipality where there is celebrated the fair of the salt and ecological products in which there will take part producers of the region of Debagoiena and nearby municipalities, as well as others come from Alava, Navarre and Burgos. The celebration includes culinary activities, trip guided by the forests of the locality and concerts of music.

Returns to Getxo the essential appointment of the lovers of the skating: Getxo Skating Race

It will be 27th of October when this IV Getxo Skating Race is celebrated at three levels of trips to be realized: school level, of 2,8 kilometers, for children; popular lever, of 9 kilometers and with participants of international level. 

Con el Puente Bizkaia de fondo, la carrera te invita a participar en un día de fiesta del patinaje en un entorno privilegiado y especialmente acondicionado.

With the Biscay Bridge in the background, the race invites you to take part in a skating holiday in a privileged and specially conditioned environment.

In November, BEC! Barakaldo assembles the best gymnasts of the world to give the best thing of himself.

 

It’s a question of Euskalgym, the only spectacle in which there take part medalists of the Olympic Games and championships of the world and of Europe. A big homage to gymnastics and a multitudinous evento in which the assistants will enjoyed the spectacular nature of this big sport that is the gymnastics.

datosGenerales.nombre: Titirijai - International Festival of puppets of Tolosa
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Titirijai involves nine days in which the streets of Tolosa are invaded by puppets, children and puppeteers. 

Nine days in which the excitement of puppeteers and their audiences fills every corner of the town, spreading out from ToPIC, the Tolosa international puppet centre.

A lot of spectacles for this awaited festival that takes celebrating in Tolosa since 1983.

datosGenerales.nombre: FIOP, the most prestigious, cutting-edge octet festival
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Once again Portugalete is to host the international shop window for eight-voice choirs. This month FIOP, the most prestigious, cutting-edge octet festival, offers an extensive programme ranging from exhibitions to concerts and documentaries.

Is the only international one of its kind and the only one held in Bizkaia.

Christmas comes and with it the Crafts Fair of Bilbao, Gabonart.

Bilbao’s Arenal Dock will host an endless number of high quality positions: ceramics, costume jewelry, toyshop, leather, wooden size, textile… and al lof them attended by the proper craftsmen. In addition to the exhibitors, there will be also demonstrations of offices, workshops and many surprises more.

galeria.titulo: The Exterior of the Crafts Fair

datosGenerales.descripcion:
On December 15, the Theater Victoria Eugenia of San Sebastian will transform in an elegant bar in the style of Cotton Club with the spectacle of Black Blue Brothers. 

Five acrobats-ballet dancers not tied to no rope will join the energy of Africa with the inimitable sound of the Rythim & Blues, dressed elegantly to the American Style. 

The black and the blue are more than two colors, and brothers something more than a simple Word. A spectacle that you cannot get lost and that find about how to thrill and entertain to all kinds of public.

datosGenerales.nombre: The Beauty and the Beast, the musical
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The musical “The Beauty and the Beast” comes to the Palace Euskalduna of the hand of the creators of “Wizard of Oz: the musical” and “Alice in Wonderland”. 

The biggest few love story ever told be able to enjoy on Wednesday, the 26th of December in two meetings; the first meeting will be at 5pm and the second one at 7pm. 

This show with songs, humour and a modern touch for the whole family, with topics that include the soul, pop, rock… between others. 

Tickets are at 18€ and can be bought on the web and the box offices of the Euskalduna Conference Centre and, also, in the Multiservice BBK ATM.

In the polyvalent space Olalde Aretoa, next Friday 28th of December the group Belako will presents its third titled disc “Render Me Numb, Trivial Violence”.

The band goes from September in International Tour, with more than 30 concerts in Russia, Japan, South Korea, Mexico, USA, Germany, England and Scotland. In Mungia they will announce the first dates of its new tour in the península. 

Tickets have the established 8€ Price in early sale and 10€ the same day of the concert.

Euskalduna Conference Centre will fill with rhythm next Friday, the 28th of December with the concert “THE POLICE BEST TRIBUTE” in that there were soundings the biggest successs of the British group Te Police like: Roxanne, Message in a bottle, So Loney… in a way as faithful as possible. 

The concert will begin from 8pm and the price of the tickets ranges between 34€ and 40€.

On Sundays at midday the former Artiach biscuit factory in the Zorrozaurre neighbourhood of Bilbao holds Open Your Ganbara. This is a market open to amateurs and professionals where everything is possible: from giving a new lease of life to objects that had been forgotten about in the attic to showing off designs under your own brand.

 

At Open Your Ganbara, dozens of people with different haircuts and profiles, from alternative youngsters to seniors reliving the magic of the journeys of their youth, come together to breathe life into a market that is different to say the least.

Zarautz is to host the top grill experts, who will be barbecuing meat and fish in the Plaza Munoa. The winning grills will be decided by two juries, one professional and the other public.

 

As well as the competition, there are lots of other activities in store: talks, public meals, pintxo tasting and more

.

Bob Dylan's Never Ending Tour comes to the Basque Country. The American musician will be performing at the BEC as part of his Never ending Tour, which began in 1988 and not stopped since. 

 

He will be revisiting his enormous back catalogue, not forgetting some of his greatest hits, today considered anthems and a part of music history.

datosGenerales.nombre: Première of the new Vitoria-Gasteiz Symphony
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Fundación San Prudencio celebrates its 50th anniversary with the new Vitoria-Gasteiz Symphony. This new version comes two centuries after the first, which was written in 1813 by Beethoven.

 

For the purpose of thanking everybody for their part in making Vitoria-Gasteiz and Álava what they are today. As well as leaving the city and its historic region a lasting work of art that can be played on special occasions.

 

It is to be previewed on 3rd April at the Teatro Principal, in the presence of the highest authorities of the state.

The MAZ Basauri festival is back this year on November.

 

Depedro, Tremenda Jauria, McEnroe and Erein among many others.

The Azkoitia-Azpeitia half marathon (Diego García memorial) is one of the most important sport events in the province of Gipuzkoa. It is an open race, as the only condition to take part in it is to be over 14 years old (no matter what sex or nationality participants are, or whether they are federated or not).

 

Each year, more than 1,000 runners take part in the half marathon, although we have to stand out the number of people in the streets cheering and supporting the athletes. Moreover, during the race there will be several provision points, so that runners can get their strength back.

The title of this exhibition, riflepistolacañon
, is taken from a drawing that visitors will see as
soon as they enter the gallery space. Made by a child and found on the
street by the artist years ago, the drawing displays an array of weapons as if it were a bellicose inventory. The phrase “riflepistolacañon” is written and pronounced as it would be by that child, ignoring the rigour of grammar and as if it were spat out.

 

Much of Jacobo Castellano’s work originates from the memory of a childhood full of abject, fragmentary images. These images that appear repeatedly throughout his work are hidden to a greater or lesser extent and have contributed to shaping one of the most unique bodies of sculptural work in our country over the past twenty years of his career.

datosContacto.direccion: Artium. Centro-Museo Vasco de Arte Contemporáneo

datosGenerales.nombre: Ahoz aho - International spoken word festival
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The International Spoken Word Festival, "Ahoz Aho", will host different events and shows, for children, young people and adults in different towns of Gipuzkoa. Tolosa and Ordizia will receive most of the events, but performances will also be held in Oñati, Hernani, Arrasate or Alegia. 

 Literary narratives, stage performances, traditional oral narratives, poems set to music and lots more, all with story-telling as the common thread linking them all together.

Donostia-San Sebastián artist Esther Ferrer opens a new exhibition that sets out to approach the venue as a living place.  The show, which can be visited at Tabakalera, focuses on the artist's works linked to prime numbers.

 

It is also accompanied by a weekly programme of actions or performances by artists invited by Ferrer herself.

APDG, the Gipuzkoa association of dance professionals, together with Donostia Kultura, is organising the twenty-third Donostia Dance Month. This is a packed programme of activities on the occasion of International Dance Day, 29th April.

 

Along with the Dance Gala at the Victoria Eugenia theatre, highlights include the now traditional "Barra de la Barandilla de la Concha" (14th April), which every year brings together nearly two thousand participants to practise classical dance movements in a spectacular setting using the promenade railings by La Concha beach as a bar.

The Victoria Eugenia theatre of San Sebastián is to stage the musical “West Side Story” by Leonard Bernstein.

 

Inspired by William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet, this love story between members of different New York gangs is one of the greatest musicals ever, and since its première in 1957 has been performed all over the world.

The Basque Dok Festival of documentary photography is an event that sets out to highlight the new photographic languages that have arisen in the documentary field, the new photojournalism 3.0 and street photography.

 

The Basque Dok Festival programme is made up of exhibitions, workshops and talks to encourage reflection and debate on documentary photography, the new challenges it faces and its development and future with the arrival of new technologies.

datosGenerales.nombre: Themed tours of the salt workings of Añana (Salt Valley)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Themed tours of the salt workings of Añana are back for the summer. They will be held on 2nd August and 6th September and start out from Plaza Don Miguel Díaz de Tuesta, next to the tourist office.  

 

They will be in Spanish and departure time is 12:00am, at a cost of €2 per person. Booking is essential.

datosAgenda.horario: 23rd June-13th July: tours at 5.30 and 7.00pm-28th July-18th August-8th & 22nd September-12th & 20th October

datosGenerales.nombre: Walk for the 25th anniversary of the Gorbeia Nature Park
datosGenerales.descripcion:
On the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the Gorbeia area being declared a nature park, the park centres in Álava (Sarria) and Bizkaia (Areatza) have organised a walk up to the cross on Monte Gorbea on 9th June 2019.

 

The event includes two hikes, one setting out from Saldropo on the Bizkaia side to end in Zarate, while those climbing from the Álava side will do the same route in reverse. The two groups will meet at the cross at the peak of Gorbea, where they will celebrate the anniversary of the Gorbeia Nature Park with a lunch.

 

Covering over 20,000 hectares, the Gorbeia nature park is the largest in the Basque Country and takes in the municipalities of Zigoitia, Urkabustaiz and Zuia in Álava province and Areatza, Artea, Orozko, Zeanuri and Zeberio in Bizkaia.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Areatza; Artea; Orozko; Zeanuri; Urkabustaiz; Zeberio; Zigoitia; Zuia

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Lili's Honour is the title of the themed tours of the Palacio Lili in Zestoa. This is a theatrical experience in a historic setting, where visitors accompany the protagonist around the rooms of the Palacio Lili, an example of 16th-century Gothic architecture.

 

Mixing real settings and people, the explanation by Andre Madalen, the last member of the Lili line to live in the house, will take visitors back to the year 1678 and reveal to them the event that interrupted the lively rhythm of the house and the ironworks.

datosAgenda.horario:
Tuesday to Friday (July & August): 4.30pm Spanish and 5.30pm Basque.

Saturdays (april-december): 11.30am & 4.30pm Spanish and 12.30am & 5.30pm Basque.

Sundays (april-december): 11.30am Spanish and 12.30am Basque.

 

From mid-December to mid-March: on demand.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Enkarterri Fest Gourmet is a gastronomic festival based on quality produce. Over two days, the small town of Zalla hosts a wide range of food-related activities, including workshops, guided tastings, showcooking, a pintxo trail, gastro-tourism, live music, sale of produce, winery tours and more.

A starring product at this celebration of pintxos, txakolis, beers and spirits, breakfasts and ice creams is the red onion of Zalla. This purple vegetable is the basis of countless dishes in traditional Basque cuisine and is one of the staples of the Slow Food international eco-gastronomic association.

People wishing to visit Enkarterri Fest can use the free bus service linking Bilbao to Zalla, laid on by the festival organisers.

Goyo Jiménez comes to Bilbao with his funniest show, “Confusio”.

 

A unique production that brings together the most hilarious moments of his career, with the aim of getting as many laughs as possible.

Kiti Mánver, María Castro, Gorka Otxoa and Inés Sánchez present the comedy “Juntos” ("Together") at the Teatro Campos Elíseos in Bilbao.

 

Author Fabio Marra deals with the topical subject of "normality". What is it? Is there such a thing as normality?  A comedy that combines laughter with feelings.

datosGenerales.nombre: "Toc Toc" group therapy packed with humour
datosGenerales.descripcion:
After more than ten years triumphing on stage in Madrid, "Toc Toc" comes to Bilbao, side-splitting group therapy courtesy of Laurent Baffie.

 

Six people meet in a famous psychiatrist's waiting room, all of them suffering from compulsive obsessive disorder (COD), but the psychiatrist doesn't turn up. What will happen?

Zarautz to host the 31th edition of Kalerki, the Zarautz Street Theatre Festival.

For three days the town will be filled with theatre, dance, music, circus and more.

Music in the open air in the Falerina gardens.  The garden of the Montehermoso cultural centre is to host concerts by local bands who are making a name for themselves.

Local groups with different styles will show their work live and in the open air.

Coque Malla is a musician who is constantly
reinventing himself. Change is his only constant, as he strives to
overcome new limits in his music. 

 

With “Revolución?” his desire to break the mould is more present than ever before.

24rd September sees this year's Getxo triathlon, a sports event with its epicentre on the Ereaga beach.

 

Taking in local landmarks like the Puente Colgante, the transporter bridge linking Getxo to Portugalete, the triathlon offers a programme with three distances: Supersprint (individual, couples), Sprint (individual, couples and relays) and Olympic (individual, couples and relays).

The Artium arts centre and museum in Vitoria-Gasteiz will be hosting the first major exhibition devoted to the work of Antoni Muntadas in the Basque Country, under the title Muntadas. Elkarrekiko loturak, interconexiones, interconnessioni.

 

The show is an analytical, transversal - not retrospective - look at the work of this artist from Barcelona, winner of the national visual arts prize in 2005, over the last four decades.

 

Since the 70s, Muntadas' work has attracted attention and opinions concerning issues such as globalisation, transnational capitalism, the microphysics of power, the construction of fear, control devices, public-private relations, the processes that manipulate information and the production of information.

The Seriesland festival in Bilbao is a competition for online or web series. Seriesland brings together the best short-format entertainment content in different categories to help boost innovation, creativity and the use of technology in the digital industries.

 

This year's edition is to be held between 7th and 11th November at different venues around Bilbao. As well as a packed programme of meetings and talks, there will be public screenings of a selection of audiovisual content, including several premieres.

Christmas illuminations are back in the towns and cities of the Basque Country, and will be there in our town centres - trees and parks, buildings, squares and streets - creating a magical atmosphere and highlighting the festive spirit of this time of year.

 

The provincial capitals will hold the traditional switching on of the Christmas illuminations in early December, when some of the surprises their designs always include will be unveiled: illuminated Christmas trees, baubles, cascades of light, whales, giant candles you can walk on and more. In some places the event is accompanied by live music and fireworks. 

 

In Bilbao, the lighting will be held on November, on the other hand, in San Sebastián will do so on December 1 and in Vitoria-Gasteiz on november 24.

datosGenerales.nombre: Welcoming the year in the mountains
datosGenerales.descripcion:
One of the most deeply-rooted traditions and one that attracts more and more people every year is that of seeing out the old year or welcoming in the new one on one of the country's highest peaks. Individually or organised by mountaineering associations, from 31st December to 1st January thousands of people climb Gorbea, Zaldiaran, Adarra, Urkiolagirre, Loatzo and other mountains.

 

The aim is none other than to add zest to this already special day by enjoying the unparalleled views of our valleys, weather permitting, and share a good hamaiketako (breakfast).

For Christmas, different towns and villages around the Basque Country hold craft markets where the public can buy products straight from the people who make them.

 

So at the Arenal in Bilbao you can visit the city's Gabonart craft market, with stalls selling high-quality pottery, costume jewellery, toys, leather goods, carved wood, textiles and more, all sold by the people who create them by hand. As well as the exhibitors, there will also be demonstrations of trades, workshops and lots more surprises.

 

The Christmas market in Vitoria-Gasteiz takes place on the Calle Independencia and in the Plaza de los Celedones de Oro, hosting a variety of stalls selling handicrafts, both local and from elsewhere. It is a chance to choose some very special presents from the wide range of handicrafts made of wood, pottery, silver, silk and glass, as well as natural cosmetics and more.

 

Inspired by the Christmas markets of central Europe, the Christmas market in San Sebastián is an unmissable date for both locals and visitors. The Paseo del Urumea and the Plaza del Buen Pastor are filled with the culture of the city: tradition, history, handicrafts, food and drink. There is also a tent where a range of activities, workshops and shows take place.

The Kutxa Kultur Artegunea venue at the Tabakalera international contemporary arts centre in San Sebastián presents this exhibition, which takes a varied journey through the multiple uses of the photographic medium made by Néstor Basterretxea, setting out from and critically considering the status of “archive”.

 

Curated by Peio Aguirre, the show consists of two related parts: an audiovisual essay/documentary, and the presentation of some of the best examples of photographic pieces by this essential artist, whose work can be found in different places around the Basque Country, from the sanctuary church of Arantzazu to his native Bermeo.

Laboral Kutxa Bilbao Surf Film Festival is a fun and educational multidisciplinary festival, developed around surfing and whose objective is to promote the cinematic universe of surfing.

 

This year the festival will be held in Muxikebarri (Getxo) on 23rd and 24th February  and from 24th to 26th February in Itsasmuseum Bilbao. The festival offers a selection of the best international surf films. Apart from the film sessions, the festival has an extensive program of free activities in Itsasmuseum museum and its sourroundings. Among these activities are sports activities and exhibitions, a solidarity walk, workshops, concerts and a lot of other surprises.

On the second Saturday in November Zegama hosts its San Martín fair, with livestock competitions, displays of vegetables and popular crafts.

 

There will also be Basque Pelota matches and a cheese competition for shepherds from the Aizkorri-Aratz nature park.

 

A unique chance to discover Zegama's spectacular natural surroundings, find out about the world of the shepherds and get to know the local food and drink.

Armintza has staged the Txapel Reggae festival since 1990 as part of its Carmen festivities.

This is an open, plural and free festival where local, Spanish and international artists come together on a bill focusing on diversity of languages and cultures.

On the Friday before the 16th July, the Día de la Sardina or Sardine Day marks the beginning of the annual festivities in Santurtzi.

According to tradition, from 6.00pm onwards many streets in the town are filled with clay pailas in which tonnes of sardines are roasted in the traditional way and handed out free.

It is traditional to dress as a fisherman.

In the evening the Mentxu, the mascot of the festivities, arrives at the town hall, kicking off the Carmen festivities.

datosGenerales.nombre: Elkano. The First Voyage Around the World
datosGenerales.descripcion:
500 years ago, from 1519 to 1522, Juan Sebastián de Elcano's expedition was the first to go around the world. Nao Victoria, commanded by the Guipuzcoan, was the only survivor of the 5 who left in search of a new route to the Moluccas, source of the most precious spices. This great feat was made possible thanks to the confluence of nautical knowledge and naval technology of the Basque Country that, from a century earlier, dominated the main sea routes of western Europe.

 

In addition to works of art, in the exhibition Elkano. The First Voyage Around the World at the Basque Maritime Museum of San Sebastián you can see various objects such as those that 500 years ago embarked on the expedition: weapons, work tools, kitchen utensils, musical instruments, fishing gear ...

 

Besides, the exhibition program will host different initiatives every month: guided, themed and theatrical visits; open meetings with specialists to promote reflection on various issues related to the expedition (astronomy, cartography, navigation, music ...); family workshops; talks and dialogues with Elkanos of the 21st century, such as the Pou brothers or Ane Irazabal and Karlos Zurutuza.

Gema Intxausti's work is linked to the new languages of sculpture developed in the Basque Country in the nineties.

 

She became interested in the use of text, drawing and photography and travelled to the United Kingdom, where she studied film and video. The series of works created using photo booths in cities like Bilbao and London is from this time.

 

She adopted this technology to produce a series of narratives constructed with a small number of pictures, which often include nods to the history of film and art.

galeria.titulo: Entre la multitud, observando el arresto

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The locality of Navaridas, in Rioja Alavesa, hosts a further edition of its historical-cultural wine fair. This is a wine fair at which visitors to Navaridas can go to exhibitions and wine tastings matched with food based on the culinary tradition of Rioja Alavesa and a guest country, which this year is XXX.

 

Local wineries once again play a starring role in the day, offering the chance to try their wines at a grand public tasting.

This year's Vitoria-Gasteiz Ironman, successor to the Triathlon, will once again bring over 2,000 athletes to the capital of Álava province to take on a spectacular route that combines nature with historic heritage.

The event begins with a 3.8-kilometre swim in the waters of the Ullibarri-Gamboa reservoir, one of the most popular places in summer among local people because of its beaches. A 180-kilometre cycle route will take them to some of the towns and villages of the plain of Álava, a perfect place for cycle touring.

They will finish off with a marathon through the heart of the city, taking them to the finishing line in the Plaza de la Virgen Blanca.

In September the Álava side of the Gorbeia nature park sees a unique natural phenomenon: the roaring of the deer. This is the mating season for about 600 deer living in the area.

 

In order to protect the species and stop them dispersing at this time of year, the Álava provincial authority takes different steps to minimise disturbance of the animals.  At the same time it organises guided tours to watch the roaring from special observation points, in small-group visits for between fifteen and twenty people.

 

The visits take place at dusk and there is a draw for places.

galeria.titulo: Roaring deer / Photo: Diputación Foral de Álava

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Orduña is a municipality belonging to Bizkaia province but forming an enclave in neighbouring Álava, surrounded by the comarca (county) of Aiaraldea (or Ayala in Spanish). Its strategic location on the border with Castile made Orduña a very important trading and customs centre for centuries, as shown by its rich architectural heritage.

 

The guided tour of Orduña's heritage is a route to see some of the town's most interesting places, from the walled part to the sanctuary church of Our Lady of La Antigua, taking in some of the grand town houses dotted around its streets.

galeria.titulo: Sanctuary church of Our Lady of La Antigua
Sanctuary church of Our Lady of La Antigua

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Bergara tourist office offers this guided tour of the old quarter of the town, which boasts some notable churches and other buildings, including the parish church of San Pedro de Ariznoa, the Torre Olaso and the Egino-Mallea and Irizar palaces.

The Monumental Bergara tour unexpectedly takes visitors to a kind of open-air museum, a set of magnificent, distinctive buildings in a range of architectural styles.  Italian and central European architecture, the Baroque of Seville and Basque Gothic...

This can be combined with a visit to the Laboratorium museum, home to spectacular scientific exhibitions in the areas of chemistry, physics and zoology, among others.

datosAgenda.horario:
Guided tours in summer: from July 1 to September 15, Monday through Friday and Sunday at 11:30 a.m. Saturdays 11:00 a.m. and 12:30 p.m.

Rest of the year: at 11:00 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. on Saturdays and special days.

datosGenerales.nombre: Dramatised visit to the old harbour in Algorta
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The old harbour in Algorta is one of its main places of interest for any visitor, because of its bustle and its food, as well as the maze of streets in this neighbourhood of traditional fishermen's houses.

 

Getxo tourist office organises dramatised guided tours of its narrow streets, for visitors to discover the curiosities and customs hidden in this picturesque place.

 

Along the way, they can visit landmarks in the life of the old harbour of Getxo like the Erriberamune parapet, the old chapel of San Nicolás and the Farol fountain.

Visit the town of Balmaseda, the first mediaeval town to be founded in Bizkaia province. Its old quarter awaits across the Old Bridge, taking us back in time to its splendid past.

 

Its cobbled streets are home to a wide range of architectural styles, including churches, town houses and palaces.

datosGenerales.nombre: Juan Luis Moraza. Gordailua 1987-1988 Depósito (Long-Term Loan)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The exhibition displays more than 60 little-known works by Juan Luis Moraza, part of the collection the artist loaned to the Álava fine art museum at the end of the 80s.

 

The highlight is a practically unknown selection of sixty-five works by the artist himself.

Bilbao city council has prepared a special arts programme to run through the summer months of June, July and August in Bilbao. The contents, aimed largely at family audiences and always in line with current health protocols, will be staged in outdoor and indoor venues and include theatre, circus, clowns, magic, dance, bertsolaritza singing and music, among other things.

 

In accordance with health measures and in strict compliance with the COVID-19 protocols in force at any time, Bilbao city council opts for quality arts and for local artists to fill its neighbourhoods with music, theatre, dance, magic and literature, among other art forms. Like this the council proposes a summer packed with arts in the city.

In summer 2020 the former Vitoria-Gasteiz water tank, now part of the Montehermoso arts centre, is to host the show Felices [Happy] by the artists Rut Briones and Raquel Durán.

 

Felices is an immersive audiovisual installation which deals with the effects cultural pressure to be happy has on us, both individually and collectively.

 

But what happens when we fail to meet these expectations? "Felices" sets out to question what happens when this obsession with a happiness on an existential scale comes into direct contact with the contradictions inherent to being human.

galeria.titulo: Felices.  Rut Briones y Raquel Durán

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Chillida-Leku museum in Hernani presents a packed programme of activities for summer 2020, to complement a visit to this venue devoted to the work of Eduardo Chillida.

 

Throughout the summer there will be concerts like the one performed by Izaro, the Kutxa Kultur dinner and concert, puppet shows, open-air film nights and watching the Perseids, known in Spain as the "tears of Saint Lawrence".

2021 sees the first Itzulia Women, a new cycle race in the UCI Women’s World Tour category. Itzulia Basque Country and women's cycling continue to grow with this project.

Itzulia Women 2024 is to take place from 10th to 12th May. This 3-day race will go through all three regions of the Basque Country to finish in Gipuzkoa province.

datosGenerales.nombre: Activities at the Mater museum boat
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The "eco-active" museum boat Mater continues to offer activities aimed at publicising and preserving the seagoing heritage of Jaizkibel-Ulia-Pasaia.

 

As well as helping to "fish" rubbish out of the sea, visitors can enjoy sea-related activities such as sailing beneath the cliffs of Jaizkibel, fishing trips, whale watching and preserving workshops, among others. Check the monthly programme.

datosGenerales.nombre: Guided tour of Vitoria-Gasteiz cathedral including a VR experience
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The cathedral of Santa María in Vitoria-Gasteiz has added a new feature to its tours in the form of a virtual reality experience. By making use of this novel technique the Old Cathedral is boosting even further the quality of a guided tour programme that has won international awards and is entitled "Open for Works".

 

This enables visitors who take a journey through the city's history as they pass within the cathedral walls to see what life was like there between the 9th and 15th centuries, as well as how the place has developed up to the present day.

 

Those interested should book the "Virtual Reality Experience and Walls" tour on the cathedral website or by telephoning 945 255135.

Debabarrena Tripontziak is an initiative offering the chance to enjoy the local cuisine of Debabarrena by trying meals prepared with seasonal ingredients at different restaurants in Eibar, Elgoibar, Deba, Ermua, Soraluze and Itziar.

 

The menus in Debabarrena Tripontziak are set meals at a price of 35€, allowing each establishment to show off their skills with local produce, naturally including vegetables and meat from the farms around Debabarrena and chocolate from Mendaro.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Eibar; Elgoibar; Deba; Ermua; Soraluze-Placencia de las Armas

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Aitzina Folk is a charity festival to benefit research into Ataxia-telangiectasia and support families affected by this rare, genetic neurodegenerative disease for which there is as yet no cure, and which affects some 30 children and young people in Spain, including two in the Basque Country.

 

Aitzina is a consolidated multicultural festival featuring local folk and traditional music as well as including a selection of international groups, demonstrations of antique instruments, traditional dances, participation by schools, workshops, street "kalejiras", talks and above all a great atmosphere.

Candlelight is a series of classical concerts in the church of La Encarnación in Bilbao, with a peculiarity that makes them very special: they take place, as the name says, by candlelight.

This means the Candlelight concerts take place in a very intimate atmosphere, a different way to enjoy programmes made up of pieces from the great musicals, soundtracks...

The Bilbao Fine Arts Museum presents La ciudad Vacía (The Empty City) by Antoni Muntadas. Curated by Guadalupe Echevarria, this is an audiovisual piece commissioned by the museum, in which the Catalan artist invites us to look at the city from a different point of view.

 

Bilbao and its current urban development, but also its historic context, are the starting point for a wider exploration of the public space and architecture.

Born in the depths of the pandemic, with an inaugural edition held in September 2020, Kursaal Film Festival in San Sebastián is a festival of online film, also known as Video on Demand, held with the aim of giving artists and audiences all over the world the chance to come together.

 

Every year Kursaal Film Festival awards three main prizes to the best short films in the categories of fiction, animation and documentary, as well as special prizes for films made in Basque, those highlighting the value of equality, those showing a world of diverse people, women film-makers and young film-makers.

This music documentary film festival is organised by the AMUA cultural association of Hondarribia and focuses on showcasing film projects in short format with music as their main theme.

 

Alongside the official competition section for shorts and videoclips with prizes in different categories, the Hondarribia musical short film festival will feature live music, DJs, a vinyl and DVD fair and live radio, among other side events.

 

The first edition of the festival is to be held from 3rd to 5th December 2021.

Every Sunday the old sheds of the Tinglados del Arenal host one of the most traditional markets in Bilbao: the Arenal flower market.

It is common to see hundreds of people thronging around the stall to buy flowers and plants, grown and picked locally by some fifteen producers. The best way to take a little gift home with you.

datosGenerales.nombre: T3T - Maratón de las cumbres de Tolosaldea (Tolosaldea 3 peaks marathon)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
T3T - Tolosaldeako 3 Tontorrak is a race for trail running enthusiasts that takes in the three peaks of the Tolosaldea area: Ernio, Uzturre and Erroizpe. A spectacular challenge to enjoy the landscape around the area.

The marathon covers a 43 km route including 2,800 metres of climbing, though there are also other, more accessible distances, including the T2T half marathon.

datosGenerales.nombre: Entre el humo y la bruma (Between Smoke and Mist): Sigfrido Koch Bengoechea
datosGenerales.descripcion:
This exhibition is made up of unpublished photographs of the Spanish Civil War, a collection of 90 images accompanied by additional material that serves to document the period. 

 

This album as such is a discovery as yet unpublished, of undeniable interest to anybody interested in the civil war and in history in general.

The Austrian soloist Birgit Kolar is to perform Bartok's 1st Violin concerto at the Palacio Euskalduna. This reveals a little-known, wholly romantic side of the Hungarian composer before his immersion in folklore.

 

Hans Graf, director of the Euskadiko Orkestra between 1994 and 1996, returns this season to directing this little-performed work.

This traditional date for vintage decoration and antiques is to take place on 4th and 5h November 2022.

It will be held in the BEC exhibition centre in Barakaldo, and tickets can be purchased for the whole weekend or for just one of the two days.

Basoan is a space under construction, a laboratory of ideas in which to approach creativity of every kind. The transformational power of art makes it a tool for us to face the challenges of today's world, like the current pandemic.

 

At Chillida Leku, a place that combines art and nature, you can meet people with similar interests, to discuss the present and imagine possible futures, using art as a tool.

datosAgenda.fechaOrientativa: Dates: March 25, April 22, May 20, June 17, July 8, September 9, October 7, November 4, December 2 and December 16

datosGenerales.nombre: Euskadiko orkestra: Mozart, Nannerl eta lagunak
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, one of the greatest figures in classical music, and his sister Maria Anna Mozart, a composer whose music has been all but forgotten, will be the protagonists of this concert.

 

Nannerl, Maria Anna's nickname, will come back to life to tell us about her brother and his music.

datosContacto.direccion: Teatro Principal de Gasteiz, San Prudencio, 29 Vitoria-Gasteiz

datosGenerales.nombre: Activities for children in Easter Week
datosGenerales.descripcion:
“Vivo en la ría de Bilbao” ("I live in the Bilbao estuary"), “Conociendo a los delfines” ("Getting to know Dolphins"), “Monstruos marinos” ("Sea Monsters") and “Conociendo los caballitos de mar” ("Getting to know seahorses") These are just some of the activities Itsasmuseum has prepared for kids to learn more about the sea without leaving the city over Easter Week.

 

Each activity lasts 90 minutes and must be booked in advance. Also, the sessions may be held in Basque, Spanish and/or English depending on what day they are held.

datosContacto.direccion: Muelle Ramon de la Sota Kaia, 1

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Laburbira reaches its 20th edition this year, with its aim of showing off its artists' work and giving them the chance of being produced in Basque. 

 

The shorts chosen for the occasion can be seen visiting towns and cities in the Basque Country and beyond.

A dance production without pretensions and aimed at fun. The two artists inhabit a shared space in which transmission is the starting point to discuss the passing of time. 

 

Serenity Suite is a piece that reveals great artistic maturity both in its choreography and in its performance. The theme of the "passing of time" runs through the piece, subtly and without nostalgia.

Under the title GEL Gerturatu Eta Lau, four bertsolari improvised singers will give a special performance of their art.  

 

The bertsolariak featured will be Haizea Arana, Etxahun Lekue, Maialen Lujanbio and Maddi Ane Txoperena.

datosGenerales.nombre: Pictorial Surfaces in the Work of Néstor Basterretxea by Peio Aguirre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Basterretxea's first artistic vocation was for painting, but in 1960 he made the leap to sculpture and film, though painting and drawing were to accompany him forever.  

 

Peio Aguirre is an independent art critic and exhibition curator based in Donostia-San Sebastián. He has curated two exhibitions devoted to Néstor Basterretxea, Forma y universo (Form and Universe) at the Bilbao museum of fine art in 2013, and Nestor Basterretxea. He has also created the documentary/essay Un retrato de N.B. (A Portrait of N.B.)

Franz Kafka shut Gregor Samsa in his room, transformed into an insect. Like this he traced the whole arc of human behaviour. 

 

 Starting out from this story, Kakerlake/Kafka plunges us into a thrilling, poetic journey. A multi-disciplinary creation where Kafka's allegory introduces the audience into the mind and thought of Gregor.
XVI. edition of one of the top festivals in the Basque music world. This year's festival will feature teachers from the national scene and top groups from the Basque Country in concert.

From  3th to 7th July, once again the landmark Getxo jazz festival is to be held in Muxikebarri, the art, culture and conference centre.  

This will be the 47th edition of this international festival will bring us the best sounds of the genre on the current scene while at the same time highlighting the work of young European bands.of this international festival, and because of the pandemic the guests will from less far away than in previous years, but without leaving out the international angle.

Euskalduna revives the festival of local artists this year, 2022. There will be different venues with stages all round the centre so that the artists will have the chance to present their project or their work live. 

 

They will have a maximum of 90 minutes and can show off projects of all kinds: theatre, music, dance or whatever.

datosGenerales.nombre: COETUR, the 7th European Rural Tourism Congress
datosGenerales.descripcion:
COETUR is an initiative that has cemented its position as the most important meeting place for the rural tourism sector. This seventh edition, entitled "Challenges and opportunities for rural tourism in 2021", is to be held in Arantzazu on 2nd and 3rd June this year.  

 

This year's host is the Basque Country, as it has been a landmark in rural tourism for many years. This year's edition will be in a mixed format, as the speakers, participants and organisers will be attending in person, but everybody else can follow the event online.

A guessing game organised by the Basque Maritime Museum in San Sebastián for young people and families. Through this game they will discover all the secrets of the waterfront district. 

 

The guessing game can be picked up at the museum and the activity will take place during its opening hours.

On 14, 15 June, the 7th edition of the Around the table, "En Torno a la Mesa” meeting will be held in Baños de Ebro/  Mañueta, an event with different spaces where you can taste wines from Rioja Alavesa and taste the best gastronomic products from the Basque Country.

In addition to having the opportunity to taste them, different producers will show a wide variety of products such as cheese, oil, typical sweets such as Basque cake, fruit, vegetables, and others, for those who want to buy them.

And to end the day, those who wish can enjoy the Sunset &Dine. A magical evening among the vineyards where you can taste local delicacies to the sound of music.

Esférica is starting up as a new festival concept, an event to enjoy with all five senses as it combines music, gastronomy, art and the land.

It is to take place over 3 days in localities including Laguardia, Labastida, Samaniego, Lapuebla de Labarca, Elciego, Villabuena de Álava and Elvillar, all of them in the heart of Rioja Alavesa.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Laguardia; Samaniego; Lapuebla de Labarca; Elciego; Villabuena de Álava/Eskuernaga; Elvillar/Bilar

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Don’t miss our dramatised guided tours. Carmen the fishwife, in
costume and accompanied by other local characters, provides entertaining
explanations of our history and traditions.

The tour ends with a recreation of a traditional fish auction in the former auction hall.

The first edition of the Bilbao Blues Festival will be held on 28, 29 and 30 July. The performances will mainly take place in the Arenal, although there will also be parades and smaller format shows in other corners of the city.

 

Blues legends such as Shakura S'Aida, Tia Carroll, The Original Blues Brothers Band, Anthony Paule Soul Orchestra, Ghalia Volt y Vasti Jackson and the Mississippi Trinity will perform at the event. Besides, Rick Estrin will also receive recognition for his career.

Ekoetxea Meatzaldea events:

 

Children's theater: Olentzero and his friends

  • Through this theater the characters will talk about the importance of recycling and caring for the environment.
  • On December 18 at 12:00 in Gallarta.
  • Activity aimed at families.

 

More information and bookings: info.penasnegras@ekoetxea.eus / 946 33 80 97

datosContacto.direccion: Bº Campo Diego, s/n. Edificio Korta

datosGenerales.descripcion:
TopaBermeo is the first open-air escaperoom in Urdaibai. It is a gymkhana that runs through the streets of Bermeo, specifically through the old town, and consists of a series of cooperative games: solving riddles, enigmas and deciphering hidden messages.

 

This activity is suitable for all ages and physical conditions, and is also accessible with a baby stroller or wheelchair.

This time the protagonists will take a journey through the human body thanks to a magic potion. Through fun songs and choreography, the audience will discover the importance of the brain and other organs of the body, healthy eating and illness.

 

They will also explore aspects of life such as equality, caring for friendship and the environment, among others.

datosContacto.direccion:
Serantes Kultur Aretoa
Máximo García Garrido, 13 Bajo

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The folk music band was formed with the aim of raising awareness of Basque folk music with a more modern and contemporary look.

 

Korrontzi has taken our culture, language, dance and music all over the world and will continue to do so this year, as they have announced the first dates of the 2022 Tour.



These are the performances they will be giving in the Basque Country:

    Sopela: 26 February

    Mungia: 3 March

    Zumarraga: 18 March

    Gatika: 24 April

    Santurtzi: 21 May

    Zumaia: 28 May

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Bakio; Sopela; Mungia; Zumarraga; Gatika; Santurtzi; Zumaia

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The aim of this championship is to transmit the values of surfing and competition among young people, as well as the care of our environment, the sea and the coastline and to promote a healthy lifestyle.

The programme includes: the surfing championship, workshops and activities, environmental ginkana, concert, skateboarding competition...

Ekoetxea Txingudi events:

 

Jaitzubia, traces of the past

  • Visit the wetland to understand its present and past.
  • November 12 from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

 

Green gymkhana

  • Game of clues and tests by Plaiaundi.
  • November 13 from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

 

Guided route: essences of Txingudi

  • Guided tour of the natural area of Plaiaundi to discover the natural, historical and ecological values of the marsh.
  • November 26 from 10:00 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.

 

Drawing workshop for adults

  • By observing nature in an artistic way, the people who participate will learn to draw in the "Rural Sketch" style.
  • December 3 from 10:00 to 12:00.

 

Trivial Ekoetxea

  • Through a virtual game, you will have to solve tests and small riddles to get to know the marshes better.
  • December 11 from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.




 

 

More information and bookings: info.txingudi@ekoetxea.eus / 946 619 389

A play that tells the story of a scriptwriter who is working on a new creation.

 

A script where the character is about to die and seconds before he is given the choice between death or the life he would have liked to live.

datosGenerales.nombre: Activities in the Armañón Natural Park
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Armañón Natural Park proposes treasure hunts and self-guided itineraries in Carranza and Trucíos. They can be done with the help of your mobile phone or tablet by reading a QR code, although some are also available on paper.

 

Treasure hunts

Getting to know the trees and bushes

  • A treasure hunt to get to know the trees and bushes of the Armañón Natural Park in a simple and funny way.

Getting to know the history and heritage

  • Educational treasure hunt to learn about nature and the history linked to the mining and industrial activity that took place in the area around the Parketxea.

Getting to know the trees and bushes

  • A treasure hunt to learn first-hand about the trees and bushes along the Agüera river, from the Basinagre neighbourhood (Trucíos) to Agüera.

 Getting to know the history and heritage

  • Educational treasure hunt to learn about nature and history along the route Alisedas del río Agüera (GR 123), which starts at Parketxe de Trucíos.

Self-guided routes

  • Route around the exterior of the Parketxe
  • Simple circular route to the viewpoint of La Zoja (2 km), where you can observe the karst formations, the views of the Carranza Valley with the Ordunte mountains in the background and the Carranza river gorge.
  • Brochure of the route available in PDF.

 

Route to Ranero

  • A route to discover the old road that linked the area around Parketxe with the Ranero neighbourhood (4.5 km) where the church of San Cipriano is located.
  •  Brochure of the route available in PDF.

 

Surbias-La Galupa Route:

  • Semi-circular route of medium-high difficulty (17.4 km.) where you can discover the pastoral station of Armañón with megalithic monuments such as dolmens, tumuli and cromlech.
  • Brochure of the route available in PDF.

 

Encinar de Sopeña Route:
