  • Semi-circular route of medium-high difficulty (19.8 km) that will allow us to walk through this unique holm oak grove under the hillside of Mount Armañón.
  • Brochure of the route is available in PDF.

 

All these activities can be done all year round.

More information: armanon.parke.naturala@bizkaia.eus / 94 656 00 79

datosGenerales.nombre: Activities in the Urkiola Natural Park
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Treasure hunts

Who am I?

  •     A treasure hunt to discover the identity of a secret character through the history and traditions of Urkiola.
  •     For all ages.
  •     Free activity.

The mysterious cloud

  •     A treasure hunt along a simple circular route that climbs Mount Saibi, in which you have to discover the name of one of the most unique meteorological phenomenon in Urkiola.
  •     From 6 years old.
  •     Free activity.

Self-guided route

The route of secrets

  •     Circular mountain route in the Saibi and Eskuagatx mountains, which shows little-known places of great natural and historical interest.
  •     From 8 years old.
  •     Free activity.
  •     GPS or Smartphone GPS application required.

 

These activities are offered all year round.

More information and bookings: urkiola.parke.naturala@bizkaia.eus / 94 681 41 55

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Aramaio; Atxondo; Abadiño; Dima; Durango; Izurtza; Mañaria

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Dantza Plazetan (Dances in the squares) brings together a series of events that take place throughout the year in different squares in Bilbao.

 

Different dance groups from Bilbao perform traditional dances such as pilgrimages, children's dances, parades of giants or travelling dance shows.

Itsasmuseum is hosting the temporary exhibition Surfing Euskadi, which will show the history of this sport in the Basque Country.

 

It will be open until October 2022 and one of its goals is to show the most representative waves of the Basque Coast and to make the Basque surfing industry more noticiable.

 

In addition, the museum has organised a workshop for children on 21 and 22 May as part of the International Museum Day programme.

From 14 to 23 June the Bilbao Bizkaia Harro event will be held with an extensive programme of cultural activities such as parades, film screenings, children's workshops, plays and concerts, among others.

It is an initiative that has been organised since 2015 with the aim of giving visibility and celebrating the LGBTIQ+ community day through sporting, musical, scientific and many other activities.

In addition, it will not only focus on Bilbao, but will also extend to the Biscayan municipalities of Derio, Santurtzi, Sodupe, Güeñes and Getxo.

The festival organised by the Villa-Lucía gastronomic space is back with a new edition. The event, which combines local gastronomy and zero miles products with culture, will offer a series of activities aimed at all audiences from July to September.

The programme includes live music evenings, comedy shows and many other activities divided into 2 themed parties: Mexican Party and 70s and 80s Party.

From 15th June to 15th September, it will be possible to visit the Muñatones Castle in Muskiz. During this period, there will be four guided tours every Sunday at the following times: 10:00, 11:00, 12:00 and 13:00.

 

Visitors can also complete their route with a visit to El Pobal and discover a hydraulic forge.

 

It is essential to book in advance:

  •     Mobile: 629 271 516
  •     Email: info@elpobal.com

datosGenerales.nombre: Workers: 11 factories in the Cadagua Valley
datosGenerales.descripcion:
This exhibition covers the presence of eleven factories in Enkarterri, one of the most industrialised areas of the Basque Country between the 19th and 20th centuries.

 

Thousands of workers worked in Balmaseda, Zalla, Güeñes, Gordexola and Alonsotegi, whose testimonies will be shown in the Enkarterri Museum, an exhibition made up of images, audiovisual pieces, illustrations and pieces of machinery.

Is a circular route through the interior of the Enkarterri region, crossing the Mena Valley, Artzentales and Karrantza.

 

This mountain walk is an event divided into four modalities spread over two days.

 

In addition, after the race there will be a bean putxera at the finish line.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Karrantza Harana/Valle de Carranza; Balmaseda; Artzentales

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The traditional Portugalete Market, also known as the village market, has been held every Thursday and Saturday since the 19th century. It was originally located in its own building in Calle Del Medio, but in 1718 it was moved to Plaza El Solar.

 

This space houses a series of stalls offering products such as ornamental and cultivated plants, fruit and vegetables, honey, cheese and other typical home-grown foodstuffs.

 

It is the perfect meeting point for producers and all those who want to buy top quality products.

The traditional San Lorenzo Market is a fair where typical farmhouse products are exhibited and sold. There are also vegetable, cheese and plant competitions.

 

This event is organised by the Getxo Town Council and, year after year, creates a special atmosphere around the Plaza de San Nicolás in Algorta.

Activities at the Artium Museoa, Museum of Contemporary Art of the Basque Country:

 

Lorategitik

  •     ARTIUM offers guided tours in summer to discover its spaces and history.
  •     Wednesdays at 18:00, Saturdays at 17:30 and Sundays at 12:30.
  •     Until 27 September.

Guided tours of the storerooms

  •     For its 20th anniversary, the museum has set up a programme of visits to an exhibition in the museum's painting storerooms.
  •     The first Saturday of every month.

 

For more information: +34 945 20 90 20 /museo@artium.org
From 22 June to 31 August, the municipality of Labastida in Alava is organising the Bastidako Kale Antzerkia festival, which will feature free street theatre performances.

datosGenerales.nombre: Activities at the Fine Arts Museum of Bilbao
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Bilbao Fine Arts Museum activities calendar:

 

BBKateak

  •     Project that aims to generate dialogues between old and modern masters. An exhibition that mixes different styles, interests, formats and disciplines.
  •     From 17 June to 31 December.

     

Thirteen to centaur

  •     Sergio Prego's exhibition is part of the BBKateak project. It is a mixture of utopian and dystopian images of the future with the intention of questioning the concept of progress that has characterised the modern era.
  •     From 6 May 2022 to 30 November 2024

 

Women in the museum

  •     The central theme of this series of exhibitions is the presence of women in art. Reproductions of works of art will be on display in public spaces in 26 towns in Bizkaia. In addition, QR codes will provide further information on each piece.
  •     From 5 May to 1 November.

 

Rubens sketches at the Musée Bonnat-Helleu in Bayonne

  • A collection of sketches by one of the most important painters in history. Seven sketches inspired by Ovid's Metamorphoses make up the exhibition.
  • Until January 22, 2023.

Multiverso

  • Through the MULTIVERSO initiative, the MULTIVERSO Grants for the Creation of Video Art are made known through the exhibition of several works resulting from the 2018 call. In this way, the aim is to promote the creation and dissemination of audiovisual artistic production. 
  • From 6 February 2023 to 1 June 2024.

 

For more information and bookings: 34 944 396 060 / info@museobilbao.com.

On October 7, 8 and 9, the Euskalduna Palace will host the Beer Fair, an event where you can enjoy more than 40 beer proposals from more than 70 local and international producers.

 

There will be live music and gastronomic proposals for people who come between 17:30 and 23:30.

 

In addition, professional beer people will also have their space, since a professional congress is being held aimed at producers, distributors, food chains and different associations.

 

Buy your ticket on its official website.

The Balenciaga and San Telmo museums will host the San Sebastián Moda Festival autumn-winter 2022 event, where international firms and brands from the Basque Country will participate.

 

The activities will be divided into four days and five spaces. Fashion talks, conferences, markets, fashion shows and fashion shows will feature on the festival's agenda, and can also be followed live on the event's official website.

Euskal Zine Bilera is one of the most important Basque film events in the Basque Country. It has been held since 1977, a time when it was a challenge to produce audiovisual projects in Basque.

 

It is a congregation whose aim is to raise awareness of Basque-language films and productions and to create a space for Basque-speaking film lovers to meet.

 

This year, once again, Lekeitio will bring together hundreds of people at the Ikusgarri Zinema cinema.

A new edition of this cycling initiative will be held in Laguardia on October 28 and consists of a gravel ride that allows you to discover Rioja Alavesa on dirt roads.

 

The organization proposes two distances: one of 79km and the other of 109km, the first aimed at people who like cycling and the second at more experienced people.

 

In addition, apart from sporting events, other types of activities can be carried out such as guided bike tours, visits to wineries and discovering the secrets of the area's gastronomy on October 27 and 28.

The Gastronomic Society Casino de Tosola organizes the Mikologika fair dedicated to mycology every year in October.

 

For three days, Tolosa becomes a benchmark for people who are fond of mycology, organizing pintxo tastings, gastronomic workshops and even trips to the mountains to collect and learn about the mushrooms that are in our environment.

Esneki is a gastronomic event specializing in cheese and dairy products that brings together congresses, cooking workshops, gastronomic championships and even markets with the best dairy products from our land.



It is celebrated every year in Tolosa, in the month of November.

datosGenerales.nombre: Christmas ice rinks in the Basque Country
datosGenerales.descripcion:
One of the most typical Christmas activities in the Basque Country is going to an ice rink with the family or with the gang. Every year the Town Halls of some cities and towns set up temporary ice skating rinks to be able to offer this recreational and sporting activity to people who want to have fun on these very special dates.

 

Bilbao

At Christmas the Biscayan capital hosts an ice rink and a slide. The ecological ice skating facility will be about 800 square meters, with half of the facility covered, and it will be located in the Arenal Pier.

 

The large slide that has 6 slide lanes will be at the Ripa Pier. Both activities can be enjoyed from November 25.

 

Vitoria-Gasteiz

In Vitoria-Gasteiz they also install a track and a slide. Located in La Florida park, the track is usually more than 600 square meters, accompanied by a 30-meter long slide, which allows you to take advantage of the slope of the square to slide down them.

 

Irun

This Christmas Irún has chosen to place three synthetic ice skating rinks spread over various locations. The largest, about 800 square meters, will be installed in the Luis Mariano Gardens and will have a circuit format.

 

The second ice rink is designed for boys and girls and will be located in the Sargia park, next to a Christmas village.

 

As for the third track, it will be an indoor track and it will be on Pius XII.

 

In addition, they will also install a slide in the Anzaran square and a Christmas market in the Ensanche square.

 

Zalla

Zalla will set up a provisional ice rink of 200 square meters in the Euskadi square. It will cost €2.

Over two hours, international singers accompanied by a rock band will be performing Queen's legendary songs. 

 

In an amazing production featuring spectacular visuals, this will be the ultimate show for fans of this legendary British band's songs.

This work by Puccini is one of the most moving and popular of operas. This is a full stage opera which will delight the audience at the Kursaal for more than 2 hours. 

 

The Kursaal conference centre in Donostia-San Sebastián is a spectacular piece of architecture by Rafael Moneo, overlooking the sea.

Cirque du Soleil, the biggest circus producer in the world, returns to the Basque Country with its show Ovo. This something to experience with the family, where a ladybird and a strange insect fall in love at first sight. 

 

Discover the world of Ovo!

datosGenerales.nombre: The sanctuary church of Arantzazu with the family
datosGenerales.descripcion:
We suggest an option for visiting the sanctuary church of Arantzazu with the family. In a 45-minute guided tour you can visit the main buildings, discover the work of Basque artists and the church's connection with art and nature. 

 

The sanctuary church of Arantzazu, perched between ravines and built on rocky crags in a wild natural setting, is part of the municipality of Oñati. 

 

  • From 7 years old onwards
  • Booking necessary 
  • Find out more: infoturismo@debagoiena.eus / 943 79 64 63
  • Dates: 11th February / 8th April / 10th June / 8th July / 12th August / 14th October / 9th December 
  • Time: 11am

datosGenerales.nombre: Belaze. A taste of the farm
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Find out about the work of the baserritarra (Basque for farmer) on a tour of the farmhouse, the vegetable plot and the stable. Feel the contact between the landscape, the land and the plants, and get to know the animals. 

Round the visit off with a taste of the farm's star product, the yoghurt it makes with the milk from its own cows. 

  • Find out more: belazebisIta@gmail.com / 611 18 82 13 
  • €18 per person / Children aged 3-12: €8 
  • Time: 10-12am

datosGenerales.nombre: Boat trip to the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The boat trip departs from the Getxo Marina, right where the Polaris Bi boat is moored. The trip, which lasts an estimated 2 hours, offers the opportunity to get to know Greater Bilbao from a different perspective. 

 

During the boat trip, you will be able to see the Bizkaia Bridge, admire the famous Zorrotzaurre Island from close up, pass under the Euskalduna Bridge and, as a final climax, see the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao from another point of view.

Komedialdia is a festival of humour that will take place in Vitoria-Gasteiz from the 2nd to the 7th of May. There will be a lot of activities around humour in theatres, streets, shops... This year's motto is: "What you see... and what it is. The power of the invisible".

 

Among the guest artists this year are Juan Carlos Ortega, the monologuist Salva Reina, the actresses Maribel Salas and Susana Soleto, Belén Nevado and Gorka Aguinagalde.

 

6 days, 17 activities and more than 36 artists await you in Vitoria-Gasteiz.

Geotxiki is a fun family geoginkana on the beach of Gorrondatxe in which, in addition to learning about geology, families will enjoy a new and entertaining activity.

 

It is an activity designed for everyone, an experience specially designed for groups or families with children from 5 years old. The youngest children will enjoy the experience learning and interacting with the environment and using tools that, although simple, give great value to learning.

 

More information: https://www.geotxiki.com/contacto

datosGenerales.nombre: Guided tours of the Sanctuary of Arantzazu
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Sanctuary of Arantzazu, perched over ravines and built on rocky outcrops in a wild and natural area in the municipality of Oñati.  It is open from 9:00 to 19:30 every day of the year and admission is free. The Debagoiena tourist office also organises guided tours:

 

Guided tour of the Sanctuary of Arantzazu with explanations about the history of Arantzazu, the basilica, artists; Oteiza, Chillida etc.

Guided tour timetable:

Low season, Saturdays, Sundays, public holidays and bank holidays 10:30 (Basque), 12:30 (Spanish). High season, from 1 June to 30 September and Easter, mornings every day: 10:30 (Basque), 12:30 (Spanish). Afternoon every day: 15:30 (Basque), 17:00 (Spanish).

Guided tour with children (+7 years): every two months, on the second Saturday.

Special times are available for groups and other times must be booked in advance.

 

Booking is recommended.

The town of Abadiño hosts the second edition of Koba Live, a festival that combines metal and rock music. 

 

Bands such as Altar of the Holocaust, Primal Fear, Sweet Rage, Mosh, Blackhearth, Angelus and Apatrida will perform on 24 June.

This spring-summer the 2023 Photographic Days Festival will be held in the coastal town of Zarautz. 

 

This is the thirtieth edition and apart from showing old photos of Zarautz there will be room for documentary and artistic photography. 

 

From 23 May to 2 July people will be able to enjoy a series of exhibitions in different spaces covering different themes.

Bilbao's Arenal will once again host the book fair that has been held for so many years. 

 

It will be its 53rd edition and will come with an extensive programme in addition to the characteristic exhibitors full of books that usually bring so much life to the area.

The new 90s is an exhibition essay by Nekane Aramburu located in the San Telmo Museum, an approach of several artistic collectives of the 90s that integrates 146 creators and collectives of the time. 

 

On 2 June, the author will give a guided tour of the exhibition free of charge to those who register in advance on the museum's website.

Benito Lertxundi will present his new album "Ospakizun Gauean" (night of celebration), his first self-produced work, at the Teatro Principal in Gasteiz. 

 

This latest work is made up of ten songs that speak of the need to unlearn in order for instinct to emerge.

 

Through this tour, the singer-songwriter will bring to the stage his best-known songs along with unreleased ones.

The singer-songwriter from Zornotzarra, Mikel Urdangarin, will perform in the Plaza de los Fueros in Vitoria-Gasteiz on 24th June. It will be free of charge and as a quartet. 

 

With 25 years of musical career, Urdangarin has produced some 19 albums, faithful to his style and his language, Basque.

datosGenerales.nombre: The world of txakoli in Enkarterri
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Let yourself be surprised by the world of txakoli! Tastings, routes, guided tours and much more about one of our wines with its own personality, txakoli. 

  • Txakoli Txabarri

Visit the vineyards of the Txabarri family in Sopuerta with a tasting of 4 varieties of txakoli.  

Dates: 10 June / 19 August 

Price: 10 euros 

  • Rolls-Royce, txakoli, vermouth and pintxos

Txakoli, vermouth, pintxos and luxury cars. The visit starts at the Loizaga Tower, where the medieval fortress that houses the largest collection of Rolls-Royces in Europe is located. After the visit, a txakoli and pintxo tasting is included at the Txurrut winery in Sopuerta.

Dates: 25 June / 3 September 

Price: 10 euros 

  • Galdames Winery 

The visit starts at the Valdivian mill where three txakolis from Bodegas de Galdames will be tasted accompanied by pintxos.  

Dates: 28 May / 11 June / 9 July / 6 August / 10 September 

Price: 10 euros 

  • Ulibarri Artzaiak 

Visit to the Ulibarri Artzaiak farmhouse in Gordexola, walk through the vineyard and tasting of txakoli and sheep's cheese.

Dates: 4 June / 8 July / 13 August 

Price: 10 euros 

  • Txakoli with pintxos... and a cave in the dark

We will discover Bizkaia's westernmost txakoli made mostly from the hondarribi zuri grape variety, which we will pair with signature pintxos. Before the tasting we will visit the Pozalagua cave in the dark with the help of a head torch, just as its discoverers did.

Dates: 18th June / 23rd July / 27th August 

Price: 10 euros 

  • Txakoli and talo workshop

Visit to the Markoleta vineyards in Güeñes with txakoli tasting paired with homemade talo.   

Dates: 24 June / 16 July / 5 August 

Price: 10 euros 

More information: https://www.visitenkarterri.com/blog/el-mundo-del-txakoli-en-enkarterri.html

datosGenerales.nombre: Exhibition: Put yourself in my eyes
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Put yourself in my eyes is an initiative created by Itxaropena, the Association of visually impaired people in Alava. 

 

It consists of a series of photographs taken and edited by people from the association and each one of them reflects a situation of everyday life from two perspectives: the vision of a person without a disability and the same image seen from the eyes of a person with a visual disease.

On 7 July, a group made up of a singer, a pianist, a percussionist and a double bass player will give a concert with a repertoire centred around the sea. 

 

Among others, well-known songs such as "Bora Bora" will alternate with French songs such as "La mer".

From 9 to 30 July, the 10th edition of the Jazzherrian Festival will be held in Agurain, an event packed with open-air concerts in different parts of the municipality. 

 

A total of 6 jazz concerts will liven up the squares of the town during the month of July.

The second edition of the Hondarribian Jazz International Festival will be held from 10 to 16 July in different parts of the city, especially in the squares located in the Old Town. 

 

This year, in addition, a marquee will be installed in the gardens of Kasino Zaharra, a space that has two objectives: on the one hand, to become a reference point from 20:00 to have a drink and listen to music, and, on the other hand, to ensure an edition without meteorological setbacks.

The Great Acrobatic Circus of China will visit San Sebastian in August, a delight for all 5 senses. It features more than 30 professionals on stage, including Olympic medallists and acrobats from Cirque Du Soleil. 

 

It will be a four-act show that invites the audience to travel along with a dreaming child who enters a fantastic world.

The artist Julia Spínola will be exhibiting her latest project "Persona, foto, copia" in Vitoria-Gasteiz, a work that includes existing works and new works produced for the occasion.

 

In the new pieces, the author copies herself and different artists in order to explore the ultimate possibilities of pleasure towards repetition through different sculptural forms. She plays with textures that cover the surfaces and with the relationships that these volumes generate in the museum space.

The fourth edition of Arabako Plazetan, the Álava Street Arts Circuit, comes with a programme of 41 theatre, clown, dance and circus shows.

 

The circuit begins on 3 June in Oyón and Nanclares de Oca and will end on 9 September in Zambrana.

Antzoki Ibiltaria is a travelling theatrical show performed on a tourist bus, a comedy that travels around emblematic points of Bilbao with very special guides who will explain all kinds of jokes and historical facts with a musical touch.

 

Gurutze Beitia, Iñaki Maruri and Mitxel Santamarina will be the protagonists of this open-air cultural experience full of humour and fun.

For yet another year, one of the most magical festivals of the year returns to Karrantza: the Pozalagua Festival. A series of musical performances held in the open air, right in front of the Pozalagua Cave, which makes for unbeatable acoustics. 

For two days the Karrantza Valley will become the setting for this emblematic festival.

Different towns in Alava will host all kinds of street arts between June and September: theatre, circus, open-air cinema, plastic arts, dance, magic and much more. 

 

Places such as Oyón, Nanclares de la Oca, Laudio, Legutio or Amurrio will be filled with shows that will liven up the summer months creating a unique atmosphere for the people who come to see them.

localizacion.nombreMunicipio: Iruña Oka/Iruña de Oca; Laudio/Llodio; Oyón-Oion; Legutio; Amurrio

datosGenerales.descripcion:
This year sees the second edition of the Boga Boga Festival, an independent music event that will take place on various stages around the city. 

 

Indie tunes will flood the streets of San Sebastian, turning emblematic venues such as the Miramar Palace, Chillida Leku and some of the city's clubs such as Dabadaba, Altxerri and Bukowski, among others, into stages.

This children's theatre show shows us rhythm, technique and dexterity for an hour in which they go through different circus disciplines and dances. 

 

A show that will transport us to live the essence of Ethiopia, the origin of the protagonists.

Once again Portugalete is to host this express film festival, now in its 15th year. Film fans of all ages will have the task of making a short film within ten hours, shot entirely on the streets of Portugalete. And the topic to be dealt with will be announced on the morning of the first day.

 

The results will be screened that same afternoon in the Plaza San Roke and the prizes awarded immediately afterwards.

Legendary British band Depeche Mode begin their Memento Mori European tour next year, showcasing their latest album, released in March 2023.

As part of their world tour, the legendary electronic band will be visiting Barakaldo, presenting their legacy for their greatest fans at the BEC.

8 bands make up the bill for the EZK festival, an event set up to promote music, culture and leisure on the Left Bank.

 

This year it is to be held in the locality of Sestao, and styles including rap, punk, rock and electronic music are all featured in this music festival. Among others, Los Chicos del Maíz, Merina Gris, Biznaga, Sua, Brigade Loco and Las Seaxpeares will be appearing

The 12th edition of this metal music festival comes with an unbeatable bill, headlined by the top heavy metal band Saratoga, currently celebrating its 30th anniversary. They will be performing for more than two hours, playing their best-known hits.

 

They will also be sharing the stage with the metal bands Infamia, Daeria and Leyenda to make this the heaviest festival ever.

A group of 24 people including actors, dancers, singers and other specialists make up the Lion King Show in a rigorous live performance.

 

This is a different kind of musical, which over 90 minutes mixes choreography, songs and special effects with humour to carry the audience off to a wonderful magical kingdom.

The Basque Costume Museum offers a journey through fashion history with the aim of appreciating the culture, costumes and aesthetics of the past through the rich fabrics, colours and prints of the garments on display.

 

The exhibition features original costumes from the 18th century up to 1950.

datosAgenda.horario:
Saturdays: 11:00-14:00 / 17:00-20:00

Sundays and public holidays: 11:00-14:00

*Closed: 1st and 6th January, 1st May and 25th December

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Marabilli is a festival created in Ondarroa in homage to the late filmmaker Aitzol Aramaio. Friends of Aramaio remember him for two days with a programme full of film screenings, music, talks, theatre and everything related to creativity. 

 

Fermin Muguruza, Arantza Santesteban, Tapia eta Leturia and Belako are just some of the protagonists of this sixth edition, which will be the last to be held in this format.

Afrikaldia is a film festival held for the third consecutive year in Vitoria-Gasteiz. The city will witness the best African cinema and its diaspora during the first week of October.

 

The Florida cinemas will be the main screen and will screen a dozen feature-length fiction and documentary films. In addition, the event will once again bring actors, actresses and directors to the Alava Campus of the UPV/EHU, which will be the point of reflection for professionals in the sector and students on the threat posed by global warming.

Passion for Knowledge is an event that takes place every three years and focuses on learning and curiosity. It also offers the opportunity to meet science celebrities up close. 

This multifaceted event aims to promote science as an essential activity for new generations and is designed to boost knowledge.

It will be attended by major figures in science who have made relevant discoveries in recent years, offering public talks by Nobel Prize winners and world-class experts in emblematic venues such as the Victoria Eugenia Theatre and the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao.

The Zumarraga Market is located in the Plaza Euskadi, very close to the Town Hall. In the same market square there is a probaleku where on 13 December, during the Santa Lucía Fair, an ox dragging trial is held.

The Market offers a sustainable and digital urban model. It is a weekly market, open to the public every Saturday, offering the best fresh seasonal produce, flowers, clothes and footwear. 

The Market is based on a digital model, and the fair has an online presence to publicise the Market stalls. It also offers the possibility of buying products online and picking them up at the ticket offices in the square.

datosGenerales.nombre: Exhibitions at the Cristóbal Balenciaga Museoa
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The aim of the Cristóbal Balenciaga Museoa is to raise awareness of the life and work of the great fashion designer, highlighting his contribution to the history of fashion and design and thus disseminating his legacy.

The museum currently has the following exhibitions underway: 

  • Balenciaga. Character: this exhibition explores a new perspective on Balenciaga's work by focusing on the characteristics of his designs. This exhibition displays 90 pieces spread over five rooms. 
  • Josep Font. Beauty and Restlessness: Josep Font is recognised as one of the most personal and appreciated creators of the 20th and 21st centuries in Spain. His work is characterised by his constant search for beauty. The exhibition brings together some of his most important creations for ready-to-wear and haute couture.

On the 10th of December another edition of the well-known Special Fair will be held in Altzo. You will be able to explore a varied selection of handmade products made by local artisans, as well as delicious fresh food directly from the surrounding hamlets, including cheeses, honey, jams and much more.

Altzo is a peaceful and picturesque place that attracts people looking to enjoy natural beauty and tranquillity in rural surroundings.

The Tolosa Christmas Special Fair will be held on the 16th of December, it is a great opportunity to get into the Christmas season and access a wide range of handmade products for the festive season.

This fair is a showcase for local crafts and Christmas products, there will also be a selection of Christmas delicacies, from traditional desserts to homemade culinary products. 

Tolosa is a municipality with an outstanding cultural life that preserves with dedication a large part of its traditions. Throughout the year, it plays host to countless celebrations and events of various kinds.

The Festival of Poetry, Culture, Landscapes and Wine, scheduled for 3 and 4 November, is a cultural event that celebrates poetry in an environment enriched by the beauty of the landscapes and the exquisite wine tradition. 

 This gathering will bring together poetry enthusiasts, artists and wine lovers to explore and appreciate the richness of artistic expression. For two days, attendees will be able to enjoy poetry readings, workshops, cultural presentations and wine tastings, which promises to be an enriching experience at the crossroads of literature, culture, nature and wine.

From the 11th to the 16th of December, the Humor en Corto week will take place, a festival full of laughter and entertainment in the town of Arrigorriaga.

The JaJam Sessions will be the heart of the festival, offering monologues, concerts, dynamics and much more, providing attendees with an unparalleled experience of humour.

The Lake is a fresh and bold version of the classic Russian ballet "Swan Lake" in "The Lake". Directed and choreographed by Víctor Jiménez, this presentation breaks with traditional paradigms. 

Instead of the typical romantic drama, this show depicts society as a backwater of white swans where the black swan rebels in search of truth and freedom. A 65-minute experience that combines physical, plastic and interpretative innovation with music by Tchaikovsky and Jorge Sarnago.

Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" comes to the Arriaga Theatre, the iconic Willy Wonka opens the doors of his enigmatic factory to take the audience on a unique musical journey.

In this show, based on Roald Dahl's literary masterpiece, the audience will be immersed in Wonka's magical world along with young Charlie Bucket and four other lucky winners of the coveted golden ticket. Guided by the unforgettable Oompa-Loompas, viewers will discover a universe full of chocolate waterfalls, mischievous squirrels, a gigantic glass elevator and a series of surprises that defy the imagination.

This musical adaptation, with unforgettable songs by Leslie Bricusse and Anthony Newley, offers a unique experience that has left its mark on every corner of the world it has touched.

galeria.titulo: Charlie y la fábrica de chocolate

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Mira-hadi is an exciting evening of theatre and music in which we will discover the life and work of the pioneering photographer Eulalia Abaitua. Her story is little known, but her legacy is an essential part of our visual memory. 

Eulalia Abaitua left Bilbao for Liverpool, where she discovered her passion for photography, becoming an extraordinary ethnographic photographer and an innovator in photographic technique.

In this event, we will recount her exciting life and show her creation through a contemporary perspective, combining theatre and music to immerse ourselves in the history and work of this fundamental visual artisan.

Sustrai, a project that symbolises union, is a space for dialogue between circus artists, led by the renowned visual artist Miren Barrena, and the public. This show represents the materialisation on stage of the ideas, fears and concerns of the participants, who, through dance and various acrobatic disciplines, put their unique identity at the service of the spectator. 

 

Each artist, coming from different geographies and with diverse personal backgrounds, shares a common need: the search for the other. Sustrai stands as a scenic testimony where the multiplicity of individual stories converge in an intriguing visual and emotional dialogue with the audience.

The Library of the Arriaga Civic Centre in Vitoria-Gasteiz has organised an event for people who love cheese: a sensory journey into the world of Idiazabal denomination of origin cheeses. 

The event will be held in Basque and the ticket price is 1€, you can buy a maximum of 4 tickets per activity.

This Christmas the Artxanda Viewpoint is transformed into a magical setting to celebrate Christmas with "Under the Stars of the Sea". From 5 December until 21 January, this iconic viewpoint in Bilbao will offer a unique light show, with the sea and its inhabitants as the protagonists.

The event will feature more than 300 luminous sculptures of jellyfish, giant octopuses and sea urchins and visitors will be able to walk among these sea creatures, immersing themselves in an underwater landscape created with tunnels.

As it commemorates its 50th anniversary, the prestigious American company Pilobolus reflects on its rich history by presenting "Big Five-Oh!", a revamped compilation of five of its most iconic pieces. Over five decades, Pilobolus has established its reputation as an internationally renowned dance company, challenging the physical limits of the body to explore its intrinsic beauty and power.

With an extensive repertoire spanning over 120 dance works, Pilobolus has made a significant mark performing on Broadway, at the Oscars and at the Olympic Games. Annually, it captivates audiences of more than 300,000 people. The company has been recognised with a Grammy Award nomination, a Primetime Emmy Award and several Lions Awards at the Cannes International Festival of Creativity.

datosGenerales.nombre: European Wildlife Photographer of the Year
datosGenerales.descripcion:
"The European Wildlife Photographer of the Year is Europe's leading and most prestigious nature photography competition, open to both amateurs and professionals. In 2023, the competition attracted the participation of 935 photographers, who submitted almost 18,000 images captured in the wildest corners of the world. 

These snapshots, which explore the essence of nature through landscapes, fauna and flora, share a common purpose: to highlight the importance of the collective struggle to protect the environment.

In 2024, the 25th anniversary of Palacio Euskalduna, an architectural and cultural icon in the heart of Bilbao, will be celebrated with great excitement. 

For this reason, Euskalduna will organise different events that will be spread throughout the year, with at least one show, event or performance every month. They will cover different artistic disciplines such as dance, music and theatre among others. 

The events will be aimed at all audiences without forgetting young people, and that is why they will plan events especially designed for them.

The different spaces offered by the Euskalduna Palace will be used, both indoors and outdoors, ideal for the warmest days of the year. 

Keep an eye out for updates on the 25th anniversary events programme on their own website.

datosGenerales.nombre: Centenary of the birth of Eduardo Chillida
datosGenerales.descripcion:
10 January 2024 will mark the centenary of the birth of the artist and sculptor Eduardo Chillida. 

To celebrate such an important anniversary, the Eduardo Chillida Foundation and Pilar Belzunce have prepared a special programme with musical events and art exhibitions that will take place from December of this year and throughout 2024.

The programme of events will begin on 2 December with the exhibition "Universo Maeght '" at the emblematic Chillida Leku museum in Hernani. It will include works by Chillida and many others such as Georges Braqué or Alexander Calder, all of them part of the group of artists promoted by the art dealer Aimé Maeght and his wife Marguerite. 

The exhibition will run from 2 December 2023 to 14 April 2024.

galeria.titulo: Peine del Viento (The Comb of the Wind)

datosGenerales.descripcion:
After its success in Berlin and Rome, the immersive exhibition on the work and life of Van Gogh arrives in Bilbao thanks to Next Museum. 

This work created in 2017 has been visited by more than five million people around the world and has been awarded the prize for best immersive experience.

Visitors will be able to enjoy the installations from 9 February.

Discover the rich history of Basque fashion at the Costume Museum in Renteria, home to over 300 original garments spanning from the 18th century to the 1920s. Housed in the baroque Kapitain Etxea building, it offers a unique experience. 

The museum not only preserves costumes, but also narrates the customs and way of life of previous generations. Immerse yourself in the evolution of fashion from the 18th to the 20th century, with exhibits that include costumes of nobles, bourgeois and families from different social strata. 

The experience culminates with the opportunity to wear replicas and capture photographic memories, inviting you to travel back in time through costume.

datosContacto.direccion: Museo del Traje Vasco de Rentería

datosGenerales.nombre: Exhibition on Picasso at the Bilbao Fine Arts Museum
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Immerse yourself in Pablo Picasso's final genius by exploring his fascinating series of Musketeers between 1966 and 1972. 

In memory of the 50th anniversary of the artist's death, the Bilbao Fine Arts Museum will host an exhibition of paintings from the last period of his life.

datosContacto.direccion: Museo de Bellas Artes de Bilbao

datosGenerales.nombre: Appointment with Poetry", meetings with poetry in Vitoria-Gasteiz
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The monthly cycle continues, bringing together different writers to talk about poetry. 

This time, Esther García will present the conference entitled "A veces el amor es azul" (Sometimes love is blue). You can also attend the next dates:

  • 23 February - Sometimes love is blue. Esther García.
  • 22 March - They talk. Zeregin Taldea, based on "Las Escritas" by Olalla Castro.
  • 19 April - Liquor and chocolate. Teresa Gómez.
  • 24 May - Encounter with Saint John of the Cross and Saint Teresa of Jesus. Dressed for verse. Conchi Leonardo and Pedro María Díaz Pedrosa.

Immerse yourself in San Sebastian's vibrant cultural scene with the fifth concert of the Euskadiko Orkestra Season, marking the centenary of Eduardo Chillida's birth. 

Enjoy the world premiere of "Chillida-Elogios" by Antonio Lauzurika. The concert offers a unique musical experience, from Joseph Haydn's Symphony No. 8, nicknamed "The Night", to Sergei Rachmaninoff's optimistic Symphony No. 3. An unmissable opportunity for classical music lovers visiting the charming city of San Sebastián.

datosContacto.direccion: Palacio de congresos y Auditorio Kursaal

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Enjoy the music with Chillida-Elogios, a tribute to the centenary of Eduardo Chillida's birth at the Teatro Principal in Vitoria-Gasteiz. Euskadiko Orkestra will present a work commissioned to Antonio Lauzurika, an outstanding composer from the school founded by Bernaola in the same city.

This event is immersed in musical diversity under the direction of Robert Treviño, who will also perform the contrasting symphonies "La noche" by Haydn and the classical and optimistic Symphony No. 3 by Rachmaninoff.

datosGenerales.nombre: Chillida Eulogies in Bilbao - Euskadiko Orkestra
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Celebrate the centenary of Eduardo Chillida at the iconic Euskalduna Palace in Bilbao.  Euskadiko Orkestra presents Chillida-Elogios, a work commissioned to Antonio Lauzurika as a tribute to the illustrious sculptor. 

This world premiere is combined with the conducting of Robert Treviño, offering a unique experience with the contrasting symphonies of Haydn and Rachmaninoff. Don't miss this event that combines musical mastery with Chillida's emotionality.

datosGenerales.nombre: Exhibition: "Discovering the Basques in Terra Nova. 16th century".
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Explore the fascinating life of Selma Huxley and discover the impact of her research on the maritime history of the Basque Country and Canada in the exhibition "Selma Huxley: Discovering the Basques in Terra Nova. 16th century" at Itsasmuseum in Bilbao. 

The exhibition reveals the meticulous work of this pioneering scientist, highlighting her archaeological findings and historical reconstructions of the Basque expeditions to Terra Nova.

Through four thematic blocks, the exhibition offers a unique experience, showing documents, objects and audiovisual pieces that narrate the exciting life of Selma Huxley, appointed Consulship of Bilbao in 1992. 

Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in the history and legacy of an exceptional figure. The exhibition will be open until 7 April.

The Provincial Council of Alava is once again organising the Sábados Musicales de Álava (Alava Music Saturdays), bringing together local artists and those from the rest of Spain. It is a series of concerts that are held throughout the year at the Fine Arts Museum.

It is a unique opportunity to get to know the local musical culture with proposals that include ancient, classical, contemporary and zarzuela music, among others. On 6 April, Mentxu Pierrugues and Susana García de Salazar will offer a four-hand piano session at 12:30. 

 

Discover the rest of the concerts programmed and get more information by clicking on the link.

datosContacto.direccion: Museo de Bellas Artes: Fray Francisco de Vitoria, 8

datosGenerales.nombre: 20th anniversary of the group En Tol Sarmiento
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The well-known Basque ska band made up of 3 people from Alava will be 20 years old next year (2025), and to celebrate it, they have organised a historic event.

 

At first they were only going to celebrate one day, but due to the success, they have had to add another date: on the 21st and 22nd of March 2025 you have an appointment. 

 ETS will recreate two festive days under the slogan "20 urte zure eskutik" (20 years of your hand) at the BEC in Barakaldo, two days that, in addition to a farewell concert, will host activities to liven up the events.

datosGenerales.nombre: Vive lo que somos (Live what we are) programme
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Vive lo que somos (Live what we are) is the invitation from the museums, halls and regional spaces to the whole of Bizkaia's society, with the aim of making people know and feel what is closest to them: Basque and Bizkaian society reflected in our centres. 

To this end, more than ten provincial venues will offer a varied programme of activities, from exhibitions to workshops and conferences, always with rigour, quality and commitment. Learn and enjoy, know and feel: this is the essence of the offer in the museums, halls and sites of the Provincial Council of Bizkaia for the year 2024.

The Matinées de Miramón have been a musical tradition in the Euskadiko Orkestra programme for more than three decades. This cycle of chamber music offers intimate and close experiences, presenting small musical gems in a reduced format.

The season stands out for the participation of the string section of Euskadiko Orkestra, although it will also include innovative proposals, such as the percussion show "Living Room Music" and the participation of local choirs such as Akelarre Abesbatza and Vocalia Taldea.

Ángel Martín lands on the stage of the Euskalduna Bilbao on 19 May with his acclaimed show 'Punto para los locos', a proposal that transcends the limits of conventional comedy to delve into the fascinating and often complex world of mental health. 

In this show, Ángel not only seeks to make the audience laugh, but also to sow seeds of reflection and awareness on such a crucial subject as the management of our emotions and thoughts.

From the prism of his own experience, the Catalan comedian addresses on stage the inner voices that we all harbour, those that range from shame to fear, anxiety and impatience. However, far from falling into solemnity, Martín uses humour as a powerful weapon to de-dramatise situations and offer tools to face them with lightness.

datosGenerales.nombre: Discover the Basque Country's industrial heritage
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Orconera Lutxana Bilduma is the Basque Government Department of Culture and Language Policy's repository of movable industrial heritage, where the rich industrial history of the Basque Country is stored. Heir to Konsoni Lantegia, the old building in Zorrotzaurre, this space houses a varied collection ranging from the first advances in agricultural machinery to emblematic elements of the iron and steel industry and other industrial sectors.

With a balanced territorial representation of the three Basque territories, Orconera houses pieces from iconic companies such as Ajuria, Altos Hornos de Vizcaya and Papeleras, among others. Its main vocation is the custody and preservation of heritage, acting as a bridge for exhibitions and specialised museums in the region.

Visits are by appointment and prior registration. To make an appointment, interested parties can contact 688670705 or send an email to orconera@euskadi.eus.

Sestao is the living image of the industrial Basque Country of the late 19th and 20th centuries. Now you have the opportunity to get to know its past and rich history through the two guided tours organised by the Sestao Tourist Office. The Workers' Route will take you through Sestao's industrial past and the Historical Memory Route will show the bombardments and stories of the Civil War. 

The first route takes in strategic points such as the great colossus of Sestao, part of the Sestao High Furnace and passes by the workers' dwelling La Unión, which houses a house-museum that can be visited. 

The Historical Memory Route visits the old bombing shelters scattered throughout Sestao. You will be able to take a look at one of the hardest events for the people of Sestao. 

The two guided tours are free of charge and start from the old Cuarto de Socorro, where the tourist office is now located. From March until February 2025 you will be able to attend these tours, which will be organised every two Saturdays a month. 

Registration is required: visit@sestao.eus /944 070 985

galeria.titulo: Altos Hornos de Vizcaya - Horno Alto nº1

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Barakaldo Theatre becomes the stage for the final of the European Stage Breakdance Competition, consolidating itself as the undisputed reference for choreographers from all over Europe. This competition not only stands out for its competitiveness, but also for being a showcase for innovation and talent in the world of urban dance.

Break on Stage is not only a festival, but a meeting place where different disciplines intertwine and merge, giving rise to new forms of expression and collaboration. It is the place where urban culture reinvents itself and projects itself into the future, inspiring a new generation of artists and spectators.

"Edonor denok inor ez" is much more than an exhibition, it is a continuation of the successful project "A place to think: Experimental schools and educational practices in the Basque Country, 1957-1977", presented at the museum in 2022.

The exhibition offers an invaluable opportunity to immerse oneself in the region's educational past. In addition, free admission is offered every day in the afternoon and all day on Sundays, facilitating access to this important cultural legacy for all interested people.

Once again this year Amurrio will hold its book fair from the 1st to the 5th of May. The fair will be full of stands offering the latest novelties from Basque and Spanish publishers and also from local record companies.

Book lovers will be able to take the opportunity to have their favourite authors, who will be announced, sign their books.

datosGenerales.nombre: 100 Years of Eduardo Chillida with the Telefónica Collection
datosGenerales.descripcion:
This exciting exhibition brings together a selection of works by the renowned sculptor that form part of Telefónica's heritage. Telefónica has been able to bring together a valuable group of sculptures and works on paper by Eduardo Chillida at the Chillida Leku museum.

The exhibition presents pieces in iron, wood, earth, alabaster and steel, which stand out for their solidity and relevance in the discourse of modernity. In addition to works by Chillida, the Telefónica Collection includes works by other outstanding artists such as Picasso, Juan Gris, Tàpies and Luis Fernández.

This is a journey through time to explore Lili's Palace and relive the life of this fascinating 17th century Basque woman.

The new season of dramatised visits joins the motto and the vindication of the 8th March, under the title "Proud", highlighting the important role of women in history and the empowerment of the younger generations.

It is a unique opportunity to explore Basque history and culture through a theatrical experience at the Casa de Lili.

In this third and final installment of the curatorial series, the Balenciaga Museum invites you to explore a new perspective on the legendary couturier's work, focusing on what makes a Balenciaga design unique and recognizable.

The exhibition presents a careful selection of 90 pieces from the museum's collection, encapsulating this iconic 20th century designer's revolutionary conception of feminine elegance. Immerse yourself in Balenciaga's mastery and legacy, and discover how his technical knowledge and mastery of fabric shaped a revolutionary vision of elegance, where comfort and simplicity reign supreme.

Explore the fascinating artistic career of Yoshitomo Nara in the Guggenheim Bilbao Museum's exhibition.

Nara, one of the most influential Japanese artists of his generation, is known for his portraits of childlike figures, which range from the adorable to the enigmatic to the menacing, becoming revered icons in the contemporary art scene.

This exhibition spans Nara's entire career, from his early works in Japan in the 1980s, influenced by his personal history and punk and underground culture, to his time in Germany, where he discovered German Expressionism and developed his distinctive style.

Find out more about the exhibition on the museum's website.

Discover a new experience at Dantzalava, where workshops invite you to explore the connection between your body, your inner sensations and outer movement.

These workshops focus on gently opening the body's inner sensations and aligning them with the outside through interrelational movement. Through simple alignment exercises and body meditation practices, you will learn to connect with your body in a deep and conscious way.

For more information, visit the Artium Museum website.

The 14-hour walk is a sporting event that runs through the mountains of Gipuzkoa and Navarre on a route of almost 70 km in length, starting and finishing in Tolosa. 

Every 4 years, on leap years, mountain enthusiasts get together for a walk with the aim of leaving the asphalted roads behind and enjoying the company of many other enthusiasts.

Come and take part in this historic route!

datosGenerales.nombre: March in memory of Iñaki Beitia
datosGenerales.descripcion:
This year the march in memory of Iñaki Beitia will take place again, starting from the Areizaga/Kalebarren square between Zumarraga and Urretxu at 7:00. As usual, the march will run through the regions of Goierri, Deba Garaia and Urola-Kosta, which is a magnificent opportunity to get to know and enjoy these beautiful landscapes.

 In total, the walk will be 29 kilometres long with a 1,500-metre climb. Participants coming from far away will be able to use the special car parks set up especially for this walk, one in the Urretxu Lyceum - located very close to the starting area - and the second located in the courtyard of the La Salle school in Zumarraga.

As every year HIRIAN returns, a preview of the BBK Live music festival. On this occasion it will celebrate live music in the streets of Errekalde, one of the neighbourhoods with the strongest identity in Bilbao.

For one day, the streets and squares of this emblematic neighbourhood will be filled with live music in a festive day of free access with a programme designed for all audiences. You will be able to enjoy avant-garde and eclectic music, typical of the festival to be held in July.

datosGenerales.nombre: San Pedro and San Marcial festivities in Irun
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Once again this year the fiestas of San Pedro and San Marcial arrive with the promise of filling the streets of Irun with music, a lot of emotion and a desire to celebrate. Every year the fiestas offer a line-up of activities and concerts that exceeds all expectations. Artists such as Huntza, La Zowi, Soto Asa and Zetak come to the city to liven up the squares and streets. 

The concerts enliven the days of parades and other events held during the San Marciales, where, whether you are from Irun or from abroad, you will find a welcoming and festive atmosphere. Check out the festival poster to find out which artists will be performing this year and the activities that will take place throughout the month of June.

The Sailing Festival is back with a large fair with workshops for adults and children, live concerts, a sailor's market and different thematic conferences. You will also have the chance to go on trips and guided tours on an 18th century sailing boat. 

For four days Portugalete will celebrate its seafaring past with all these activities in this eighth edition of the festival, which will fill the docks and the historic centre of the town with a seafaring atmosphere.

This year Herrian is being held in the town of Sondika, just 15 minutes from Bilbao. It is a pre-BBK Live festival programme that organises a series of free open-air concerts in a different town in Bizkaia each year. 

This edition features performances by Cala Vento, Chill Mafia and María Escarmiento among others, concerts that will fill the streets of Sondika with music.

datosContacto.direccion: Parque Larrabarrena, Plaza Goiri, Estación de tren

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The festivities in honour of the patron saints of San Salvador and San Ramón Nonato in the Trapagaran valley are coming up, with a programme that includes more than a hundred very varied festive events aimed at all audiences, so that different audiences will find events to their liking in the programme.

On 6 August the day of San Salvador will be celebrated and from 28 August to 1 September the fiestas of San Ramón Nonato will be held with many concerts and activities that can be enjoyed by the public.

This innovative programme is aimed at audiences of all ages and will include theatre, dance, circus, clown and music performances by companies from the Basque Country. The performances will take place at 18:30, except on 4 May and 15 June, which will be at 21:00.

Enjoy all the variety of performances offered by Getxo Eszena in Plaza Estación de Las Arenas.

The 4th edition of Haziberri, a Basque music concert festival in Gernika-Lumo, has arrived. The aim of this event is to find natural spaces where music merges with its surroundings to create a unique experience. 

Get your ticket to enjoy a selection of the best artists singing in Basque for an entire afternoon.

Get ready for four days of music and good atmosphere at the Arrasate Blues Festival!

Enjoy live performances with national and international blues artists. Come and experience the passion for the blues in the heart of the Basque Country!

The Folklore Academy invites dance lovers to enjoy watching the traditional dances of the area in Vitoria-Gasteiz. The public has the opportunity to participate by learning and dancing these traditional dances.

The dances will start in the central park La Florida from 19:30 in the evening.

Vitoria-Gasteiz is programming a series of open-air concerts in the Secret Water Garden park. The Municipal Band will play concerts with a varied repertoire of themes and genres. 

Dates of the next concerts:

5 July: Nature and imagination with works such as 'Stonedge' by Sara Galiano or 'The phoenix ascending' by Galante Rossano.

12th July: VIVA SAN FERMÍN! GORA SAN FERMIN! The music will take you on a journey to the txupinazo, the Riau Riau, the dances and the bullring.

19th July: Jazz in the garden. This concert will feature the premiere of four works composed especially for wind orchestras.

13 September: Far East with sounds from places like Singapore, Korea and Thailand.

Folkez Blai is the folk music festival-contest held in Ermua. During this celebration, the streets of this town become the perfect place for folk music lovers. 

From all the proposals submitted, the jury will select six groups for the second phase of the competition, which consists of live performances in the town. On the last day the jury makes its decision and announces the winner.

On the occasion of the fiestas of Aiete in San Sebastian, the bertsolaris Maialen Lujanbio and Beñat Gaztelumendi will walk through the streets of the neighbourhood, accompanied by the municipal txistularis and the members of the Kantu Jira.

 

The day will start in Hiru Damatxo square in the Aiete neighbourhood of San Sebastian. It is the ideal opportunity to get to know the tradition and folklore of the Basque Country.

Vertical dance is a discipline that is becoming more and more popular in the Basque Country and at this meeting, fans will have the opportunity to learn and see unique performances.

In addition to the workshops and talks, on the 18th there will be a showcase of two short pieces for all the public.

Irun is once again holding its long-awaited pop and indie-rock music festival with a line-up full of hits and singers from the current scene. For two days, the Ficoba events venue will be filled with atmosphere and music for all audiences.

Second edition

After the success of the first edition in 2023, the festival returns for the second time and promises to be one of the festivals of reference this summer.

The history of Bilbao's neighbourhoods is brought to life once again with BILBAO IZAN, dramatised visits to promote the heritage of the Biscayan capital. There will be 8 dramatised routes through the neighbourhoods of Zorrotza, Indautxu, Otxarkoaga, Iralabarri, Uribarri, San Adrián, Begoña and Deusto.

These are free, open-air guided tours, on foot, with a pleasant and accessible route, which will include characters dressed in period costumes.

datosGenerales.nombre: Lords of the sound - Film soundtracks
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Hans Zimmer's music occupies a special place in the contemporary film industry, transporting us into the heart of cinematic events.

Through the mastery of a symphony orchestra you can listen to the soundtracks of films such as Dune, Interstellar or Spider Man.

Dantz Point is a musical platform whose main feature is that its sessions are held in emblematic or historic venues, in some cases little known. At the same time, it seeks to generate new audiences, new schedules and new experiences for all kinds of audiences.

 

On this occasion, Dantz Point comes to Azpeitia to Sanagustin Kulturgunea, in the centre of the town. Get your tickets before they run out.
